When it comes to that point where you don't know what decision to make amongst options to marry. When you can't seem to find any peace in your soul to go on with the person you have chosen to marry. Shut down everything. Hold up that proposal. Delay that wedding. Emotionally disconnect from that person for about three days. And spend some good time with the Holy Spirit. Do not talk too much in the place of prayer, its not about long hours of tongues, it's more about long hours of meditative listening. Just listen. Meditate on the Word and just listen. Learn the art of emotionally disconnecting to hear from the Lord. Your problem is that you want to talk mushy on the phone with that person for 3hours, then pray 5minutes and expect 21 Angels to appear in your dream with an answer from God. You want to go on dates and spend the weekend together, then read one verse of the Bible and expect to ascend into the inner courts of God for an encounter that will reveal the name of your spouse. Our emotions will always be in conflict with our discernment. Our emotions will remain the greatest resistance to an encounter with God in whatever form. Disconnect, go away with God for a while, so that you can hear clearly. text: A PRAYER FOR PROTECTION #PrayforIsrael #prayforpeace O God, author and giver of peace, in whose image and likeness each of us has been created with a human dignity worthy of respect on earth and destined for eternal glory, Listen to the cry that rises from every corner of this fragile earth, from our human family torn by violent conflict: Give peace in our time, O good and gracious God, that peace which, as your son Jesus Christ told us and as we have experienced in these days, is a peace which the world cannot give. To world leaders grant the wisdom to see beyond the boundaries of race, religion, and nation to that common humanity that makes us all your children and brothers and sisters to one another. To those who have taken up arms in anger or revenge or even in the cause of justice grant the grace of conversion to the path of peaceful dialogue and constructive collaboration. To the innocent who live in the shadow of war and terror, especially the frightened children, be a shelter and strength, their haven and hope. And to those who have already lost their lives as victims of human cruelty and chemical warfare, open wide your arms and enfold them all in the embrace of your compassion, healing, and everlasting life. Grant this through Jesus Christ, your son, our Lord. Mary, Mother of all and Queen of peace, pray for us.

That was a good result for Australia, and it is not unchristian to say so. To explain why, here is the short opinion piece I had published in The Australian in September 2022... My views have not changed. STARTS. In February 1957 the National Council of Churches in the US distributed a blistering attack against racial segregation in a pamphlet written by Baptist minister Martin Luther King Jr for the 35th annual observance of Race Relations Sunday. ‚ÄúAll men, created alike in the image of God, are inseparably bound together,‚Äù King wrote. As the apostle Paul reminded us in his declaration on Mars Hill, it was ‚ÄúGod who made the world and everything in it, being Lord of heaven and earth‚Äù. He ‚Äúmade from one man all the nations that they should inhabit the earth‚Äù. King was building the theological foundation for the great civil rights campaigns of the 1960s, for the fight against a society and a system of laws that divided a nation against itself along racial lines. Dividing a country by race, he argued, was ‚Äúa tragic evil that is utterly un-Christian‚Äù. Yet a nation divided by race is exactly the desired outcome of those seeking to enshrine an Indigenous voice to parliament in the Australian Constitution. We are told by proponents of the voice that democratic institutions are not good enough for Indigenous Australians but they need their own, Indigenous-only, race-based body within the structures of government. Not only do they claim this will correct the injustices of the past, they also claim this is the only way to guarantee Indigenous Australians can have a say over the laws and policies that affect them. If this were true, it would mean our democratic institutions are so broken they are unable to incorporate the ambitions and aspirations of Indigenous Australians. Apart from anything else, this is a blatant denial of the reality that there are currently 11 Indigenous parliamentarians and an Indigenous Australians minister overseeing a multibillion-dollar government department. But the idea of the voice is presupposed on the false notion that Australians are so divided by skin colour ‚Äì black v white ‚Äì that an institution of general function, like a democratic government, cannot act in the best interests of both. Why? Because according to the world view that underpins the voice, white Australians are so irredeemably trapped by the privilege afforded to them by the colour of their skin and the racist structure of our colonising democracy that we couldn‚Äôt hear Indigenous Australians even if we wanted to. That is exactly what is preached to us by the advocates of identity politics and critical race theory. They say that conflict and oppression between races is inevitable and, worse, that we cannot escape these destructive forces because we are marked by our skin colour and the structure of our society. We cannot presume to speak for each other and we cannot presume to act in each other‚Äôs best interests. A white politician can never fairly represent a person of colour, nor can a person of colour be fairly treated by a white-majority institution such as parliament. Of course, this is a lie. Anyone can tell the truth and anyone can act in the best interests of anyone else ‚Äì because we are all humans first. These false ideas lead to the inevitability that the voice will become the woke voice. It won‚Äôt be the Indigenous voice, it will be the critical race theory voice, the identity politics voice. The result of the voice will be a Constitution claiming that I, as a white man, am inescapably an oppressor to people of colour. It is a permanent statement that our nation is irredeemably segregated by a barrier to our shared humanity that cannot be scaled ‚Äì our race. Under this postmodern world view, racism is a human condition. It‚Äôs not about individual acts of racial prejudice, it‚Äôs about the racist structure ‚Äì the systemic racism ‚Äì that is baked into us and all that we do. Clearly, none of this is true and the reality is very different. Anyone can reach out a hand to help anyone. It comes down to something Christianity reveals to us because we believe that one God made one man from whom all races are descended. There is one race, ultimately: the human race. Our democracy as expressed in our Constitution rightly presupposes the equality of every Australian. As the apostle Paul reminds us, the kingdom of God is colourblind, for ‚Äúthere is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female: for you are all one in Christ Jesus‚Äù. Our temporal, earthly ‚Äúkingdoms‚Äù do well to model the greatest kingdom of all. Our Constitution should remain colourblind. And Australians would be wise to be wary of the voice and the sinister ideas behind it. For, as King reminded us, a nation segregated by race is a blatant denial of the unity that we are all offered in Christ. ENDS.

"In dealing with conflict, we should first contemplate that our adversary wants to be happy and be free from suffering, just as we do. Next, try to see things from their point of view. By looking at the situation from their perspective, we‚Äôll be able to see clearly who has the mistaken idea, and who is in error. We will be able to see our own faults clearly, too. If, through this contemplation, we find that we are the ones in error, then we can begin to address those faults in ourselves. Should we confirm that yes, the other person is the one who is confused and at fault, we‚Äôll still be able to see the situation with compassion. We‚Äôll recognize that they are trying for happiness, but they misunderstand how to attain it. They might be harming us, and others too, yet we can understand that their behavior is actually impeding the happiness that they‚Äôre trying to achieve." -Mingyur Rinpoche Read more through joy.tergar.org #mingyurrinpoche #tergar #joyofliving #conflict #compassion #conflictmanagement #empathy #meditationteacher

This short documentary is five years old and gives a great insight into the issue of Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank. To understand the conflict it is necessary to understand the manner in which these settlers have prevented a two state solution from eventuating. It's also important to note, and I recall from my own time in Israel, that many moderate and secular Israelis despise these settlers and their dogmatic beliefs. It has been consecutive right wing Governments that have refused to reel them in or prevent their growth. I think it is also important to reflect on the Jewish yearning for statehood as a historically persecuted people. It certainly doesn't forgive their treatment of Palestinians but the context of their story over the past 2000 years has to be considered.

Water is vital for life, but in Goro Dola Woreda, drought and conflict make it difficult to find clean water, especially for women and girls. Many water sources are broken or unsafe, causing water borne diseases and safety risks. Bontu Roba, 20, is a pastoralist woman who lives in Tache village of Goro Dola Woreda, Oromia region. She is one of the 2,400 individuals who benefit from the rehabilitated hand-dug well by Mercy Corps with USAID support. The Water Sanitation and Hygiene Committee (WASCO), a group of community members, are responsible for managing and operating the water supply and sanitation facilities in their area. WASCO aims to ensure that everyone has access to safe and clean water and good hygienic practices. The support helped Bontu and residents gain access to clean water, decreased disease prevalence, and minimized the risk of violence. The USAID Humanitarian Assistance and Response Program-II helps conflict and drought affected communities in Somali, Oromia and SNNP regions with water, sanitation, nutrition, and health needs. The program also increases knowledge of public health risks and safe hygiene practices.

text: 10 lessons from the book Surrounded by Idiots: The Four Types of Human Behavior (And How to Effectively Deal with Each One) by Thomas Erikson: 1. There are four types of human behavior. Erikson identifies four types of human behavior: Reds, Yellows, Greens, and Blues. Reds are direct and assertive, Yellows are optimistic and social, Greens are analytical and cautious, and Blues are empathetic and caring. 2. Each type has its own strengths and weaknesses. Reds are good at getting things done, but they can be abrasive and insensitive. Yellows are good at building relationships, but they can be flaky and unreliable. Greens are good at solving problems, but they can be indecisive and perfectionistic. Blues are good at understanding people, but they can be overemotional and avoidant. 3. It's important to understand your own type and the types of the people around you. This will help you to communicate more effectively and to build stronger relationships. 4. You can't change people's types, but you can learn to deal with them more effectively. By understanding the strengths and weaknesses of each type, you can learn to adapt your communication style and to avoid unnecessary conflict. 5. Reds need to be direct and to the point. If you're dealing with a Red, be clear about what you want and don't beat around the bush. 6. Yellows need to be appreciated and encouraged. If you're dealing with a Yellow, be sure to praise their work and to let them know how much you value their contributions. 7. Greens need to be given time to think things through. If you're dealing with a Green, don't rush them into making a decision. Give them time to weigh all of the options carefully. 8. Blues need to feel understood and supported. If you're dealing with a Blue, be a good listener and offer them your support. 9. It's okay to say no. If you're feeling overwhelmed or uncomfortable with a request, it's okay to say no. Don't feel guilty about setting boundaries. 10. Don't take everything personally. It's important to remember that people's behavior is often a reflection of their own issues, not of you. Try not to take things personally and to focus on the positive aspects of your relationships. Erikson's book is a valuable resource for anyone who wants to improve their communication skills and to build stronger relationships. It is a book that can help you to understand yourself and the people around you better. Surrounded by Idiots is a popular book, but it has also been criticized for being simplistic and for promoting stereotypes. It is important to keep in mind that there is no one-size-fits-all approach to dealing with people. The best way to build strong relationships is to be genuine and to treat each person as an individual. On 14 October 1066 the armies of William, the Duke of Normandy, and the Anglo-Saxon King Harold Godwinson clashed near Hastings, in one of the most famous battles in history and one that would decide the fate of the English throne. Unusually for battles of the time, the clash at Hastings lasted all day. The conflict was only ended by groups of Anglo-Saxon warriors breaking discipline and charging from out of their shield wall. They were then surrounded, cut off, before being cut down by Norman warriors. Late in the day, the Anglo-Saxon King Harold was hit in the eye with an arrow. It was a fatal blow. With their king dead, the retreating Anglo-Saxons were defeated. The Normans were victorious. Learn more with our 1066 Collection, featuring documentaries and podcasts on different aspects of the clash - from the role of archers on the battlefield to the Bayeux Tapestry. Hundreds Gather For Pro-Palestine March In London Hundreds of people gathered for a pro-Palestinian demonstration in central London, on Saturday, October 14. This demonstration took place amid police warnings that anyone showing support for Hamas could face arrest, The Independent reports. In videos of the demonstration, the people are seen with Palestine flags and supportive placards while chanting, "From the river to the sea, Palestine will be free," among others. More than 1,000 officers were also deployed by the Metropolitan Police for the march, which saw supporters gather to express solidarity with Palestine as the conflict between Israel and Hamas continues to escalate. Credit: Youtube| The Telegraph

Secondly, in the immediate sense let‚Äôs try and support whatever reliable charities and relief efforts are able to get through to our family in plight. We are deeply saddened and concerned for the animals suffering in the midst of the Israel-Hamas conflict. Having previously worked in both Palestine and Israel, we never expected to witness organized violence targeting innocent animals. Our partner on the ground, Let The Animals Live (LTAL), based in Ashkelon, Israel, runs a shelter and clinic. Despite the devastating rocket attacks in Ashkelon, they managed to relocate 32 sick and injured dogs and cats to their shelter in Kfar Ruth, Israel. We are determined to ensure the safety of these animals, and here's our plan to make it happen: Our team, Let The Animals Live (LTAL), accompanied by veterinarians, has traveled south with essential supplies, including pet food and equipment, to assist as many animals as possible. Although the most dangerous areas are currently inaccessible, the resources funded by your donations are reaching courageous volunteers in those regions. These volunteers are risking their lives to provide critical, life-saving aid to street animals and abandoned pets in the most desperate situations. Your donations are crucial to support their efforts. Please join us in this mission by sharing this post and making a generous donation today: https://bit.ly/3Fc2tBC.:=:https://networkforanimals.org/donation/ Together, we can save as many of these four-legged survivors as possible. Photo credit: AP/Ohad Zwigenberg

Tatjana Omanovic was taken from us abruptly and prematurely on July 25th, 2023. A mother of four, she was an immigrant who overcame poverty and deprivation to become a US Marine and a budding entrepreneur. Her family are at a loss without her. Tatjana was born in 1974 in Hamburg, Germany and grew up in Serbia, then part of Yugoslavia. When possible, her family summered on the Adriatic, cementing an early love of the ocean and sun. She was an accomplished kayaker who was preparing to represent her country in the 1992 Olympic Games when the brewing Balkans conflict redirected her life forever. At age 15, she emigrated to the US, where she lived with her father in a van in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, until his tile-installation business afforded him the money for a modest home. With only two sets of clothes to her name, Tatjana taught herself English ‚Äì one of her seven languages ‚Äì and enlisted in the Marine Corps in 1994. She served as a linguist for Special Forces operating in the Balkans, followed by postings in Washington DC, Hawaii, North Carolina, Iraq and San Diego over a 20-year career. She started her family in Virginia in 2002 with the birth of twins Dorian and Adrian, with Sebastian joining them in 2005. Despite lengthy deployments, she and her boys would be emotionally inseparable for the remainder of her life. Tatjana's romance with Owen Dickinson began in 2008, when both were Marines. As he puts it: Theirs was a love for the ages, and he is heartbroken. Tatjana retired from the Corps in 2014 as a gunnery sergeant and settled with Owen and the boys in Carlsbad, California. Aleksandar arrived in 2015. Despite a lengthy list of military accolades, she considered her family her greatest achievement. She was a connector of people who found success outside the military in businesses as varied as brokering mortgages and promoting wellness. Her beauty, generosity and magnetic personality were paired with a heart bigger than her petite frame should have been able to support. Everyone dies. Not everyone truly lives. Tatjana was an example for all of us. In addition to her husband and children, she is survived by her sister, Aleksandra Clark.

People often describe the Israel‚ÄìPalestine conflict as one that goes back decades. But as our Deputy Foreign Editor Edmund Heaphy explains, the conflict has ancient origins | Read more: https://rte.ie/b/1410812:=:https://www.rte.ie/news/world/2023/1013/1410812-israel-palestine-conflict-history/

The fact that nothing happened in America yesterday on the ‚ÄúGlobal Day of Jihad‚Äù which was called for by a Hamas leader, just further shows that this latest iteration of the Israel-Palestinian war is not America‚Äôs war. Many were fearing a massive wave of terrorist attacks here, like the ones Hamas carried out in Israel last weekend, but nothing happened. The conflict there has been going on there for 75 years, and it‚Äôs not our problem. We have plenty of our own. There are tragedies around the world every day. We can‚Äôt abandon our own citizens to go and try to help others at the expense of Americans every time we see viral videos and a news cycle about conflicts on the other side of the globe. Yes it‚Äôs sad. There‚Äôs a lot of sad things in the world. But America can‚Äôt rob Peter to pay Paul. We have to take care of OUR citizens. Our borders. And our country. Remember: Al-Qaeda attacked the United States on 9/11, not because they ‚Äúhate our freedom‚Äù as the Operation Mockingbird assets all sung in concert, but because of our financial and military backing of Israel which angers many Muslims around the world who side with the Palestinians in the ongoing territorial disputes in the region. Years later when Congressman Ron Paul said that the attacks were ‚Äúblowback for decades of US intervention in the Middle East‚Äù he was attacked for ‚Äúblaming America,‚Äù but the intelligence agencies and foreign policy experts all know the truth. Inside job / false flag theories aside, this was still the case. One of the most prominent ‚Äúconspiracy theories‚Äù of what happened is the LIHOP hypothesis, the ‚Äúlet it happen on purpose‚Äù theory, which doesn‚Äôt negate Al-Quada‚Äôs hatred for America or their involvement in planning and carrying out the attacks on 9/11 (even if they were aided and directed by the CIA and other intelligence agencies). This is why the Iranian government (and Muslim terrorist organizations like Al-Qaeda, ISIS, Hamas, etc.) call America the ‚ÄúGreat Satan,‚Äù and sometimes chant ‚ÄúDeath to America.‚Äù We need to put America FIRST. This is not our war. It's not our problem. Those who make it our problem are going to only bring those problems to our shore again.

OPEN HEAVENS DEVOTIONAL DATE: SUNDAY OCTOBER 15TH 2023 THEME: THE LAND OF ENDLESS SUFFERINGS MEMORISE: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. Matthew 13:42 READ: Matthew 13:24 30, 36-43 24 Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field: 25 But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way. 26 But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also. 27 So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares? 28 He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up? 29 But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them. 30 Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn. 36 Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field. 37 He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man; 38 The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one; 39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels. 40 As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. 41 The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity; 42 And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. 43 Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear. MESSAGE Those who don‚Äôt end up in the City of God will end up in another place that I cannot describe as a city. I can only describe it as a place of endless sufferings because it is a land of unimaginable horrors. All the residents of this horrific place are in constant suffering for eternity. That place is called hell fire (Mark 9:47). The first thing you need to know about hell fire is that it is a place of torment. Luke 16:23 describes the experience of a man in hell as follows: ‚ÄòAnd in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.‚Äù All occupants of hell are tormented non-stop. In Mark 9:48, Jesus tells us some of the things that torment them: ‚ÄúWhere their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.‚Äù The passage does not say ‚Äòthe worm‚Äô does not die, but ‚Äòtheir worm‚Äô. In other words, worms will be coming out of the body of the people there, and these worms cannot be killed. They just keep eating their victims up. Also, there is an unquenchable fire there that keeps burning the occupants of hell non-stop. In Matthew 25:41, Jesus said the fire is everlasting. Revelations 14:11 says the smoke of their torment in hell goes up forever and that there is no rest day or night; the torment just goes on without stopping for eternity. A drop of water will be a luxury to the people in hell (Luke 16:24). Can you imagine such torment? There is no nightmare that can compare to the actual experience of hell fire. There are many passages in the Bible where Jesus described hell as a place where there will be a lot of weeping, wailing and gnashing of teeth. Even assuming that the torments are the cause of their wailing, what then would make them gnash their teeth? Gnashing of teeth is something people do when they regret their actions or inactions. The people in hell will be gnashing their teeth for eternity, regretting that they did not live holy lives when they were on earth. You are still here on earth, so you have the opportunity that those people will give anything to have again. You have the opportunity to repent and start living holy now. If you delay until it is too late, you would remember this message in hell and wish you had listened. Choose wisely. REFLECTION Think about it carefully: are you willing to go to hell because of that sin you keep committing? If not, sop it today. BIBLE IN ONE YEAR: Mark 6-7 AUTHOR: PASTOR E. Finishing Strong: Going the Distance for Your Family by Steve Farrar is a book about how to maintain a strong family through the challenges of life. Here are eight lessons from the book: 1. Finishing strong is more important than starting strong. Everyone makes mistakes, but it's how you finish that matters. If you're committed to your family, you'll keep coming back, even when it's hard. 2. Your family is your most important ministry. Don't neglect your family in the pursuit of other goals. Make time for your spouse and children, and let them know that they are your top priority. 3. Your marriage is the foundation of your family. Invest in your relationship with your spouse. Communicate regularly, resolve conflict in a healthy way, and show each other love and affection. 4. Be a good role model for your children. Children learn by watching the adults in their lives. Model the behaviors and attitudes that you want to see in your children. 5. Don't be afraid to ask for help. No one can do it alone. If you're struggling, reach out to other family members, friends, or professionals for support. 6. Forgive yourself and others. Everyone makes mistakes. When you or someone in your family makes a mistake, forgive them and move on. 7. Focus on the positive. It's easy to get bogged down in the negative aspects of life. But it's important to focus on the good things as well. Make time for fun and laughter, and appreciate the blessings in your life. 8. Never give up. There will be times when you feel like giving up on your family. But don't. Remember that your family is worth fighting for. If you are looking for a book that will help you to be a better husband, father, and family leader, I highly recommend Finishing Strong: Going the Distance for Your Family by Steve Farrar. Oct. 14, 2023 In consultation with partners on the ground, The Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA) made a very tough but prudent decision to evacuate YAGM personnel, including the 5 Young Adults in Global Mission from the Holy Land and the country coordinators. We are relieved to share that everyone is safe. The images coming out of the news are heartbreaking and we extend our prayers to the Palestinian and Israeli people who have lost loved ones and are living in fear and uncertainty. We are deeply troubled by the escalating conflict and the impact it has on civilians. The ELCA has longstanding relationships with many partners in the region, including the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Jordan and the Holy Land and Augusta Victoria Hospital, which is operated by the Lutheran World Federation. For the last 30 years, the ELCA has had a presence of mission personnel, including a Young Adults in Global Mission program in Jerusalem and the West Bank. We did not take lightly the decision to evacuate our staff, and at the same time will always put their safety first. We pray for peace and justice.

MY SUGAR MUMMY CALLED " I've dated my girlfriend for two months now, and she has been a wonderful girl. Unlike other ladies I've dated, she's so special and homely. Whenever she visited, she'd always do some cleanings for me. She has taught me how to cook some common foods so that I would stop buying every single meal from outside. She visited me two days ago, slept in my house, and yesterday morning, a call woke me up from bed. It was my mummy, but I saved her second number with 'Sugar Mummy'. I didn't pick the call as I knew it was gonna be long and she might perceive I slept with a woman... she's a strong Catholic and wouldn't tolerate such. Immediately she saw that I didn't pick the call, she forcefully took my phone from me and saw it boldly written, 'you had 2 missed calls from Sugar Mummy'. She threw the phone on the bed and picked her stuffs. While I was trying to hold her and explain, she hit the door on me and left. Since then, she hasn't been picking my calls. I know I've once been reckless and so carefree about Relationship, I'm truly serious with her and I want to marry her. This is not the first time a thing like this has happened. It seems she is hot tempered and very jealous. And when she is upset, you dare not come close to her. I'm so confused right now. The truth is that I don't want to lose her". I engaged him for up to thirty minutes, and in our long conversation, I gave him a little task to do. He actually granted I share this story for instructional purposes that's why you are seeing this. . . The only advice I have for you is to be as open as possible in your Relationship and marriage. If you have things about you that could trigger distrust, conflict or malice, make out time and tell your partner about it... don't let them get that as a surprise. Do you know why? If they find out themselves, you may not be certain how the reaction would be. On the other hand, no matter how upset you're, try and listen. Don't conclude with what you think, because what you think might be totally wrong. Give your partner a listening ear, so as to validate what you're thinking and possibly dialogue. I reposted this to serve as a reminder, feel free to add your own advice if you have. If you want to discuss your relationship with me, send me a direct message through the messenger, I'll attend to you. Remember, when you read a post you learnt from, it's wise to Like and Share. My desire is for you to have the very best Relationship experience before and in marriage. Do have a lovely day. #cyprainnwako Image Credit: Smiling Couple

"In dealing with conflict, we should first contemplate that our adversary wants to be happy and be free from suffering, just as we do. 

Next, try to see things from their point of view. By looking at the situation from their perspective, we‚Äôll be able to see clearly who has the mistaken idea, and who is in error. We will be able to see our own faults clearly, too. If, through this contemplation, we find that we are the ones in error, then we can begin to address those faults in ourselves. Should we confirm that yes, the other person is the one who is confused and at fault, we‚Äôll still be able to see the situation with compassion. 

We‚Äôll recognize that they are trying for happiness, but they misunderstand how to attain it. They might be harming us, and others too, yet we can understand that their behavior is actually impeding the happiness that they‚Äôre trying to achieve." -Mingyur Rinpoche

I can only describe it as a place of endless sufferings because it is a land of unimaginable horrors. All the residents of this horrific place are in constant suffering for eternity. The last weeks amounted to what was essentially a siege. American forces used flamethrowers and napalm to great effect, and heavy artillery and air attacks provided essential support. Eventually, armored bulldozers collapsed cave entrances, entombing Japanese soldiers within the bowels of the earth. Peleliu was finally secured by the end of November 1944, when organized Japanese resistance ceased. Colonel Nakagawa committed suicide after ordering his regimental flag burned. Virtually the entire Japanese garrison of 11,000 was wiped out. The record shows that 202 prisoners were taken in the campaign, and only 19 of these were Japanese. The rest were Korean or Okinawan laborers. The Peleliu campaign was one of the bloodiest of the entire Pacific War, but it had a curious postscript. On April 27, 1947, Lieutenant Tadamichi Yamaguchi led 26 survivors out of hiding and handed over his samurai sword in a token of surrender. Yamaguchi and his men made the last formal capitulation of World War II, a conflict that had ended 20 months before in 1945. #ww2 #army #victory #usmarines #usmc #MilitaryHistory #war #ww2history

COUNT YOUR BLESSINGS 

When upon life‚Äôs billows
You are tempest tossed,
When you are discouraged,
Thinking all is lost,
Count your many blessings,
Name them one by one,
And it will surprise you
What the Lord hath done.

Refrain:
Count your blessings,
Name them one by one,
Count your blessings,
See what God hath done!
Count your blessings,
Name them one by one,
And it will surprise you
What the Lord hath done.

Are you ever burdened
With a load of care?
Does the cross seem heavy
You are called to bear?
Count your many blessings,
Every doubt will fly,
And you will keep singing
As the days go by.

When you look at others
With their lands and gold,
Think that Christ has promised
You His wealth untold;
Count your many blessings.
Wealth can never buy
Your reward in Heaven,
Nor your home on high.

So, amid the conflict
Whether great or small,
Do not be disheartened,
God is over all;
Count your many blessings,
Angels will attend,
Help and comfort give you
To your journey‚Äôs end.

(John¬≠son Oat¬≠man, Jr., 1897)

Emotional intelligence (EI) is the ability to recognize, understand, manage, and effectively use your own emotions and the emotions of others. Developing your emotional intelligence can lead to improved interpersonal relationships, communication, and overall well-being. Here are five elaborated tips to enhance your emotional intelligence: üëãSelf-Awareness: 1. Recognize Your Emotions: Pay close attention to your feelings without judgment. Identify and label them accurately. For example, instead of saying you're "stressed," specify if you're feeling overwhelmed, anxious, or frustrated. 2. Monitor Physical Signals: Be mindful of how your body responds to emotions. Stress might manifest as muscle tension, a racing heart, or shallow breathing. Recognizing these physical cues can help you identify your emotional state. üëãSelf-Regulation: 1. Practice Impulse Control: Avoid reacting impulsively to strong emotions. Take a moment to think before responding to a situation, allowing yourself time to consider the consequences of your actions or words. 2. Manage Stress: Develop healthy stress management techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, exercise, or engaging in hobbies to prevent emotions from overwhelming you. üëãEmpathy: 1. Active Listening: When interacting with others, truly listen to what they're saying, not just the words but also their tone and body language. Try to understand their perspective and feelings. This shows that you care about their emotions. 2. Put Yourself in Their Shoes: Try to imagine how the other person feels in a given situation. This helps you understand their viewpoint, which is crucial for showing empathy. üëãSocial Skills: 1. Effective Communication: Work on your verbal and non-verbal communication skills. Express your thoughts and emotions clearly and respectfully. This includes both positive and negative feedback. 2. Conflict Resolution: Develop the ability to resolve conflicts amicably. Acknowledge differing emotions, seek common ground, and find mutually beneficial solutions. üëãMotivation: 1. Set Goals and Stay Committed: Establish clear, achievable goals and stay motivated to achieve them. Emotional intelligence is closely tied to intrinsic motivation and a sense of purpose. 2. Resilience: Emotionally intelligent individuals can bounce back from setbacks. Cultivate resilience by viewing challenges as opportunities to learn and grow, rather than as insurmountable obstacles. Enhancing your emotional intelligence takes time and practice. It's a journey of self-discovery and self-improvement. By focusing on self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, social skills, and motivation, you can significantly improve your ability to understand and manage emotions, both in yourself and in your interactions with others, leading to more fulfilling and harmonious relationships. You are still here on earth, so you have the opportunity that those people will give anything to have again. You have the opportunity to repent and start living holy now. If you delay until it is too late, you would remember this message in hell and wish you had listened. Choose wisely. REFLECTION Think about it carefully: are you willing to go to hell because of that sin you keep committing? If not, sop it today. BIBLE IN ONE YEAR: Mark 6-7 AUTHOR: PASTOR E. The loss of so many Palestinian and Israeli lives is heartbreaking. Though my role as a Virginia State Legislator has limited impact on foreign policy, as a Palestinian-American, I am sharing my perspective during this difficult time. There are families across Virginia who mourn or fear for friends and loved ones impacted‚Äîincluding mine. Please know this, while I am no expert on these matters, I do appreciate how complex the situation is. Here are four points we should consider: 1. The atrocities committed by Hamas against Israeli civilians are reprehensible and should be denounced by all. 2. The mounting civilian casualties in Gaza from indiscriminate bombing by Israel is devastating. Israel‚Äôs blanket denial of food, water, and other necessities to Gaza is a serious violation of international law and only harms the innocent civilians ‚Äì half of whom are children. 3. The targeting of civilians is a war crime, no matter who does it, and I urge the international community to work to protect the innocents on both sides of this conflict. 4. All hatred ‚Äì including antisemitic, anti-Muslim, anti-Arab ‚Äì should be called out and rejected. No person, anywhere, should have to live in fear of hate and violence. We cannot ignore each other's humanity, each of us deserve equal rights, freedom from oppression, and a life of dignity. My friends, I pray for the lives lost and the ones fleeing terror. I know that the continuation of violence will never bring peace. I hope we can all agree, the Palestinian and Israeli people deserve to live lives free of fear with equal dignity. As the situation only escalates, we stray further from that dream. I pray for a cease-fire and de-escalation to save lives.

The symbolism of Ravana‚Äôs 10 heads

Every year, Sanatanis (Hindus) around the world celebrate Deepawali, a festival that commemorates Prince Sri Rama‚Äôs return to his home, Ayodhya, after defeating the powerful King Ravana. 

Presented as the victory of good over evil, knowledge over ignorance, and spiritual light over darkness, narrations of their conflict often convey Ravana as a one-dimensional figure, whose heinous acts, including the kidnapping of Devi Sita, slate him as irredeemably demonic.

No matter how terrible a person appears, however, Sanatan Dharma teaches that nobody is ever completely evil. Ultimately, everyone originates from the Divine, and so everyone is actually pure in nature. Often caught up in the dualities of life ‚Äî like hot/cold, ugly/beautiful, and old/young ‚Äî many have a tendency to forget this nature, as they do all they can to attain what they want and avoid what they don‚Äôt want, despite how their actions might affect those around them.

Hence, like all, Ravana was a complex being, who exhibited not only negative qualities, but positive ones throughout his life‚Äôs journey. An expert warrior, politician, king, as well as astrologer and doctor of ayurveda, he took great care of his kingdom, for even the poorest of its inhabitants were well off, and never poverty stricken. Also an exceptional poet and scholar, each of the 10 heads he is often depicted with are said to symbolize the six shastras and four vedas, as he was a famed devotee of Shiva, the God of Transformation.

But, like many before him, and many after, he was led astray in his desire for pleasure, succumbing to a medley of life‚Äôs vices in his pursuit of so-called happiness. Thus, as his hunger for power expanded, his 10 heads of knowledge became better known as symbols of the 10 qualities that exude those who are attached to such power. 

They are:

Kama (lust)

Krodha (anger)

Moha (delusion)

Lobha (greed)

Mada (pride)

Maatsarya (envy)

Buddhi (intellect)

Manas (mind)

Chitta (will)

Ahamkara (ego)

According to the Bhagavad Gita, success in spiritual life depends on a steady intelligence, which can only exist through control of the senses. When we focus too much on an object of the senses, attachment develops. Prolonged attachment turns into intense longing, or lust, and when the object of our lust is not obtained, anger arises. Becoming blinded by anger, we fall into delusion, causing bewilderment and a loss of intelligence, as we lose sight of our true spiritual identity.

In the case of Ravana, Devi Sita was the object of his senses. Controlled by lust, he took her by force and grew angry when she refused to be with him. Blinded by his anger, he lost all intelligence, believing he could defeat her husband Sri Rama, an avatar of Sri Vishnu, who inevitably killed him.

Good and evil, like everything in the material world, are relative, and have no real meaning in connection to divine figures like Rama and Sita. Therefore, a true characterization of Ravana is not that he was a demon, but that he was a person who failed to control his senses, going down a path that led to forgetfulness of his real spiritual identity.

As such, to avoid going down a similar path, we must all strive to act selflessly by controlling our senses, practicing discipline in pursuit of spiritual advancement, rather than our own selfish desires. By such discipline, we can transcend mundane notions of good and evil, and see every person for what they truly are ‚Äî magnificent and beautiful expressions of the Divine.

By Syama Allard

THE FULL MEANING OF THE WORD ''WIFE'' Some of people will ask, what is the meaning of wife?, who is a wife?, how do you know a wife material?, and so on, but the answer is not far fetched. It your opinion that makes you define your meaning to wife. In this article, i will define wife in an acronym, which are; W - Wise in communication I - Industrious and Innocent in character F - Forgiving in conflict E - Excellent in counsel and comfort If as a wife, this acronym does not tally with your character, you can never win your spouse. Let analyse the acronym, one by one. 1. W - Wise in communication Many wives have wrecked their homes and marriages due to poor communicating skill. As a wife, you need wisdom to communicate certain issues and ideas to your spouse. A great communicating skill will help you have great access to your husband and home at large. 2. I - Industrious and Innocent in Character Secondly, if you want to win your husband to yourself, you must be Industrious i.e hardworking. You may be hardworking in the circular aspect, but you also need to bring it to family and marriage aspect. Try as much as possible you can to put the house in order and your marriage will be like heaven here on earth. Also, as a wife, you must try as much as possible to be innocent in character. This means that your spouse should not have reason to suspect you, neither should he think that you are always keeping a secret from him. You must be plain in dealing with him. 3. F - Forgiving in Conflict In every relationship, conflict is always part of the journey and it has an antidote which is forgiveness. As a wife, forgiveness means letting go the pains you received when being hurt. It also means surrendering your right to hurt you back if you hurt me. One may be tempted not to forgive considering the gravity of the offense, but if you let it grow into full hatred, you are gradually losing your emotions towards the relationship and if not careful the relationship may be dissolved. 4. E - Excellent in counsel and comfort Lastly, as a wife you must be able to give great counsel to your husband and not evil one just as Jezebel in the Bible. With these, your marriage will have a smooth ride. Thanks for reading

According to NPR, ‚Äòall of the Gaza Strip's borders are closed, leaving Palestinian civilians with nowhere to escape.‚Äô Gaza is one of the most densely populated areas in the world, with a population of more than 2 million. The strikes are considered to be retribution after Hamas militants stormed into nearby Israeli towns on Oct 7, killing dozens of residents and taking approx 100+ people hostage. More than 1,900 people have died on both sides of the conflict.

It‚Äôs a time of tension and mourning for Palestinians outside of Gaza, where the fighting is the fiercest. A trip into the West Bank and to Jerusalem reveals the anguish over the conflict and lives lost.

A Death adder (Acanthophis antarticus) which was relocated from a Berrara property garden bed today. The owner was trimming up some lavender when the snake was discovered. Unlike other elapid species the Death Adder won‚Äôt retreat when encountered but rather rely on its stealth and camouflage to avoid a conflict. A timely reminder to always stay vigilant at this time of year when doing tasks such as gardening.

STATEMENT ON THE REFERENDUM RESULT The outcome of the referendum has understandably left many people wondering ‚Äòwhat now‚Äô for relations with Indigenous Australians. My sincere hope is that the defeat of this particular proposal - a constitutionally enshrined voice to parliament- is not understood as a rejection of the ongoing process of reconciliation with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. Whatever your vote, we must avoid the temptations of both triumphalism and defeatism and recognise that the task of ensuring better outcomes for Indigenous people can only be advanced if we come together as Australians in genuine charity and recommit ourselves to closing the gap of disadvantage that Indigenous Australians face. The obligation on us all, and particularly Catholics informed by the Gospel and the social teaching of the Church, is to affirm and uphold the dignity of every human person; to seek unity and reconciliation in circumstances where division and conflict are present; and to work together for the flourishing of all people regardless of race, belief or background.

Dear Heavenly Father, We come before you with heavy hearts, burdened by the conflict and violence that has befallen the land of Israel. Lord, we lift up our brothers and sisters in Israel who are living in fear and uncertainty due to the ongoing war. We pray for your divine protection to surround them, keeping them safe from harm. Lord, we ask for your wisdom to guide the leaders of Israel, that they may make decisions that lead to peace and understanding. Strengthen their resolve to seek reconciliation and harmony amidst the chaos of war. Bring forth leaders who will advocate for justice and peace, working tirelessly to end the conflict and restore tranquility to the region. We pray for the soldiers on the front lines, risking their lives to protect their homeland. Grant them courage, strength, and resilience as they face the challenges of war. Be their shield and fortress, Lord, and bring them back to their families unharmed. Lord, we also pray for the innocent children, families, and individuals caught in the crossfire. Comfort those who are grieving, heal the wounded, and provide for those in need. May your mercy and compassion envelop them, offering solace in the midst of destruction. Lord, we know that you are the Prince of Peace, and we earnestly beseech you to bring peace to the land of Israel. Let your love and understanding prevail over hatred and discord. Inspire all parties involved to seek dialogue and understanding, paving the way for reconciliation and lasting peace. We offer this prayer in faith, trusting in your divine wisdom and infinite love. May your grace abound in Israel and the entire region, bringing an end to this conflict and ushering in an era of harmony, understanding, and coexistence. In the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord and Savior, we pray. Amen."

text:
The symbolism of Ravana‚Äôs 10 heads

Every year, Sanatanis (Hindus) around the world celebrate Deepawali, a festival that commemorates Prince Sri Rama‚Äôs return to his home, Ayodhya, after defeating the powerful King Ravana. 

Presented as the victory of good over evil, knowledge over ignorance, and spiritual light over darkness, narrations of their conflict often convey Ravana as a one-dimensional figure, whose heinous acts, including the kidnapping of Devi Sita, slate him as irredeemably demonic.

No matter how terrible a person appears, however, Sanatan Dharma teaches that nobody is ever completely evil. Ultimately, everyone originates from the Divine, and so everyone is actually pure in nature. Often caught up in the dualities of life ‚Äî like hot/cold, ugly/beautiful, and old/young ‚Äî many have a tendency to forget this nature, as they do all they can to attain what they want and avoid what they don‚Äôt want, despite how their actions might affect those around them.

Hence, like all, Ravana was a complex being, who exhibited not only negative qualities, but positive ones throughout his life‚Äôs journey. An expert warrior, politician, king, as well as astrologer and doctor of ayurveda, he took great care of his kingdom, for even the poorest of its inhabitants were well off, and never poverty stricken. Also an exceptional poet and scholar, each of the 10 heads he is often depicted with are said to symbolize the six shastras and four vedas, as he was a famed devotee of Shiva, the God of Transformation.

But, like many before him, and many after, he was led astray in his desire for pleasure, succumbing to a medley of life‚Äôs vices in his pursuit of so-called happiness. Thus, as his hunger for power expanded, his 10 heads of knowledge became better known as symbols of the 10 qualities that exude those who are attached to such power. 

They are:

Kama (lust)

Krodha (anger)

Moha (delusion)

Lobha (greed)

Mada (pride)

Maatsarya (envy)

Buddhi (intellect)

Manas (mind)

Chitta (will)

Ahamkara (ego)

According to the Bhagavad Gita, success in spiritual life depends on a steady intelligence, which can only exist through control of the senses. When we focus too much on an object of the senses, attachment develops. Prolonged attachment turns into intense longing, or lust, and when the object of our lust is not obtained, anger arises. Becoming blinded by anger, we fall into delusion, causing bewilderment and a loss of intelligence, as we lose sight of our true spiritual identity.

In the case of Ravana, Devi Sita was the object of his senses. Controlled by lust, he took her by force and grew angry when she refused to be with him. Blinded by his anger, he lost all intelligence, believing he could defeat her husband Sri Rama, an avatar of Sri Vishnu, who inevitably killed him.

Good and evil, like everything in the material world, are relative, and have no real meaning in connection to divine figures like Rama and Sita. Therefore, a true characterization of Ravana is not that he was a demon, but that he was a person who failed to control his senses, going down a path that led to forgetfulness of his real spiritual identity.

As such, to avoid going down a similar path, we must all strive to act selflessly by controlling our senses, practicing discipline in pursuit of spiritual advancement, rather than our own selfish desires. By such discipline, we can transcend mundane notions of good and evil, and see every person for what they truly are ‚Äî magnificent and beautiful expressions of the Divine.

By Syama Allard

I've written this more as a self-reflection rather than a reminder for others, as most of my time every week is spent teaching Islam. As we watch the news and see the calamities befalling the ummah one after the other, we may wonder... Why spend more time in worship, study and learn Islam when our ummah is suffering? Shouldn't we *do* something 'practical' instead? Allah says in the Qur'an, "Allah will elevate those of you who have faith, and ÀπraiseÀ∫ those gifted with knowledge in rank." (58:11) In a time where the Muslims as a whole suffer from humiliation and condescension, it is faith and knowledge that will help raise our rank and status. Also, despite all the persecution & conflict the Prophet SAW and his Companions faced in both Makkah and Madinah, their worship and study/teaching of the Qur'an did not falter, and still occupied most of their time. So we maintain our worship and our learning in Islam. This does not absolve us of practical action, whether it be debunking lies and propaganda about Islam & Muslims, advocating for the rights of Muslims everywhere, protesting, giving sadaqah and participating in whatever other option we have that is Islamically sanctioned, wise and constructive to help our brothers and sisters over the world. There is no conflict or contradiction between the two. And tawfiq is only from Allah.

OPEN HEAVENS DAILY DEVOTIONAL DATE: SUNDAY OCTOBER 15TH 2023 TOPIC: THE LAND OF ENDLESS SUFFERINGS MEMORISE: "And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth." - (Matthew 13:42) READ: MATTHEW 13:24-30, 36-43 (KJV) 24 Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field: 25 But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way. 26 But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also. 27 So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares? 28 He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up? 29 But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them. 30 Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn. 36 Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field. 37 He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man; 38 The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one; 39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels. 40 As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. 41 The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity; 42 And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. 42 Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear. MESSAGE: Those who don't end up in the City of God will end up in another place that I cannot describe as a city. I can only describe it as a place of endless sufferings because it is a land of unimaginable horrors. All the residents of this horrific place are in constant suffering for eternity. That place is called hell fire (Mark 9:47). The first thing you need to know about hell fire is that it is a place of torment. Luke 16:23 describes the experience of a man in hell as follows: "And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom." All occupants of hell are tormented non-stop. In Mark 9:48, Jesus tells us some of the things that torment them: "Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched." The passage does not say 'the worm' does not die, but 'their worm'. In other words, worms will be coming out of the body of the people there, and these worms cannot be killed. They just keep eating their victims up. Also, there is an unquenchable fire there that keeps burning the occupants of hell non-stop. In Matthew 25:41, Jesus said the fire is everlasting. Revelations 14:11 says the smoke of their torment in hell goes up forever and that there is no rest day or night; the torment just goes on without stopping for eternity. A drop of water will be a luxury to the people in hell (Luke 16:24). Can you imagine such torment? There is no nightmare that can compare to the actual experience of hell fire. There are many passages in the Bible where Jesus described hell as a place where there will be a lot of weeping, wailing and gnashing of teeth. Even assuming that the torments are the cause of their wailing, what then would make them gnash their teeth? Gnashing of teeth is something people do when they regret their actions or inactions. The people in hell will be gnashing their teeth for eternity, regretting that they did not live holy lives when they were on earth. You are still here on earth, so you have the opportunity that those people will give anything to have again. You have the opportunity to repent and start living holy now. If you delay until it is too late, you would remember this message in hell and wish you had listened. Choose wisely. REFLECTION: Think about it carefully: are you willing to go to hell becasuse of that sin you keep committing? If not, stop it today. It never made sense to suggest that Hamas planned such a large scale attacks for such a long time (two years, according to a senior Hamas official) right there in Gaza without the knowledge of the Israeli Intelligence which is one of the most sophisticated in the world. The same Israeli intelligence that has eyes and ears in the whole region, not just in Gaza...the same Agency that managed to unmask the identities of the scientists working on Iran's nuclear program and covertly eliminated them one after the other right inside Tehran? The same Israelis that inspect almost every single thing that enters Gaza with their checkpoints all over the place? No nah! The Egyptians have confirmed getting intel about the attacks before they were carried out. CNN just announced that the U.S got intel about the attacks too. The same CNN has aired videos showing Hamas fighters training for the attacks with one of their training camps just a kilometer away from an Israeli security post. A betting man would bet the Jewish authority got intel about the attacks but deliberately did nothing just so they could have a valid justification to finally up-root Hamas from Gaza once and for all. Anyone who has been following the conflict knows the Israelis have never been comfortable with the fact that their number 1 enemy is in charge of Gaza from where they could always fire multiple rockets into Israeli towns and cities. But it is reasonable to assume that Hamas must have considered all possible responses from the Isrealis including ground invasion of Gaza which will kick-off any moment from now, before launching last Saturday's attacks. So what is their game plan? Were they banking on Iran joining the fray directly, not through their proxy like Hezbollah or they were hoping to use the humanitarian catastrophe unfolding in Gaza to blackmail Israel into halting their retaliatory actions? I'm really curious as to how Hamas thought a Nation that went to war in 2006 killing 1,300 Lebanese and losing 165 of its own people JUST BECAUSE TWO OF ITS SOLDIERS (not civilians ooo) were abducted by Hezbollah, would respond when you attack its civilian population.

text: Gaza hospitals were overwhelmed with casualties Saturday as the conflict between Israel and Hamas entered a second week. Witnesses said Israel struck a building in Khan Younis in southern Gaza that housed about 50 people who had fled there after the IDF ordered more than 1 million people to evacuate the north. A hospital in Gaza City treated casualties from what Hamas called an Israeli attack on a convoy heading south along one of two routes Israel had declared ‚Äúsafe.‚Äù Hamas said 70 people were killed. Israel said it was too early to establish who was responsible. The Palestinian Health Ministry said Saturday that 15 medical facilities have been damaged in Gaza, and two hospitals have closed. Meanwhile, many Gazans holding foreign passports gathered at the Rafah crossing into Egypt after word spread that they would be allowed to leave. Reports said the evacuation was put on hold until an agreement could be reached to allow aid into Gaza through the crossing. #GazaHamasConflict #IsraelGazaCrisis #KhanYounis

British journalist accuses Western media of bias in reporting on Israel-Palestine conflict‚ÄºÔ∏èBritish journalist, Harry Fear, has accused Western media of exhibiting bias in its coverage of the Israel-Palestine conflict, saying the ‚Äúoverarching storytelling‚Äù is based on the Israeli narrative, Anadolu Agency reports‚ÄºÔ∏è Speaking to Anatolia, Fear, known for directing the 2019 documentary, ‚ÄúGaza: Still Alive‚Äù, critiqued the language used by mainstream Western media while reporting on the conflict that flared up last week after a surprise attack by Palestinian group, Hamas, on Israel. Since then, Israel has continued heavy bombardment of Gaza, and has cut its water and electricity supplies, further worsening the living conditions of the Territory that has reeled under a crippling siege since 2007. What we are looking at now is a bloodbath, a bloodbath designed to exact revenge on the Gaza population Fear said. He said the Western media focused on unverified information about Israeli civilians, while neglecting the suffering of Palestinian civilians, especially children who were killed over the years. Singling out the BBC and other reputed media organisations for their choice of words when covering the Gaza conflict, Fear said the British public broadcaster used distinct terminology in its reporting, referring to those killed in Gaza as ‚Äúdied,‚Äù and those in Israel as ‚Äúkilled‚Äù. Fear also criticised other mainstream outlets for their apparent lack of empathy towards Palestinian civilians. Because Palestinians have basically been categorised effectively as unpeople, humans that are just, well, ‚Äòhuman animals‚Äô, to use the word of the Israeli officials,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äôs very much how the mainstream narrative captures the story as well He said ‚Äúthe framing of the conflict in this latest round of fighting usually completely silences the context of 16 years of strangulation and siege, an ongoing war on Gaza, complete denial of Palestinians, human rights, civil rights, political economic rights, really that ‚Äúdignity as humans at all, largely based on an ideology of racial supremacy and domination.‚Äù The British journalist also highlighted the rapid dissemination of false and manipulative news regarding the conflict, saying: ‚ÄúThe point is, of course, this is an ongoing war between Israel and Palestinians, and part of that is an informational war. It is a propaganda war.‚Äù Commenting on an allegation by an Israeli journalist who claimed live on air that Hamas beheaded 40 Israeli babies, Fear said: ‚ÄúIs it true that Hamas carried out beheadings of 40 children? Well, it looks like that that isn‚Äôt true, because there ‚ÄúThere has been no evidence.‚Äù But, he added, ‚ÄúThe story was then fed effectively throughout the English-speaking western media landscape, including landing on the front pages of major London newspapers.‚Äù Children ‚Äúhave already been beheaded by Israel‚Äôs aerial bombardments, but that is of little to no report in the Western reportage,‚Äù he said. https://www.middleeastmonitor.com/20231013-british-journalist-accuses-western-media-of-bias-in-reporting-on-israel-palestine-conflict/

text: As demonstrations condemning the violence in the Middle East continue to grow across the globe, we have connected with and listened to the concerns of our local communities who feel impacted by these international events. We realize violence and large-scale demonstrations happening globally can instill a variety of emotions in Calgarians, leaving some feeling fearful. In an effort to ensure all Calgarians feel safe in our city, today our officers proactively increased patrols near local places of worship and other areas of significance. We also setup our Mobile Command Vehicle downtown to ensure our officers are prepared to initiate a response to potential incidents. At this time, there is no direct threat to the public in Calgary, and, we continue to work with other law enforcement agencies, community leaders and local groups in our city to monitor the situation. It is standard practice for police to monitor all major, planned events and demonstrations, manage public safety, keep the peace and respond to any calls for service accordingly. So far, there have been no incidents reported in Calgary in relation to the conflict in the Middle East. We police behaviour, not beliefs. Hate-motivated crimes of any kind have no place in our community and we will not tolerate behaviour contrary to the law that is associated with hate speech or harassment. We encourage anyone who is planning an event or a demonstration to review the information on our website: calgarypolice.ca/protesting:=:https://www.calgary.ca/cps/community-programs-and-resources/protesting-in-calgary.html. We are committed to working with groups who want to organize an event that provides a safe and peaceful opportunity for demonstrators to exercise their lawful rights. Our objective is to work with all parties to ensure public and officer safety, and to maintain orderly conduct and peace.

Signs of a Narcissist Narcissism, a personality disorder characterised by a sense of entitlement, lack of empathy, exploitation, and envy, is often accompanied by specific behaviours that can help identify individuals afflicted by this condition. Exhibiting an inability to listen to others' opinions is a prominent sign of a narcissist. Such individuals are so infatuated with themselves that they dismiss any viewpoint contrary to their own as irrelevant or inconsequential. Another common characteristic of narcissists is their incessant need for control. They seek to dominate others in every aspect of life, whether personal or professional, refusing to relinquish control even when it is unwarranted or inappropriate. In relationships, this need leads to the erosion of trust and stifles the growth of those around narcissists. Narcissists also exhibit a tendency to hold grudges, unable to forgive or forget perceived wrongs. Their inability to handle conflict maturely and move on from it hampers healthy relationships and perpetuates a cycle of strife. Furthermore, narcissists consistently evade taking responsibility for their actions, often shirking blame onto others. They have an uncanny ability to absolve themselves of any wrongdoing, leaving their victims feeling frustrated and invalidated. Moreover, a narcissist always views themselves as faultless and consistently blames others for their failures or shortcomings. In their eyes, rules and societal norms do not apply to them, as they believe they are special and deserving of exceptions. This sense of entitlement fosters a disregard for authority and a contemptuous attitude towards regulations. Finally, a narcissist exhibits an insatiable appetite for more; no matter how much they receive, it is never enough. Whether it is attention, admiration, or material possessions, they constantly seek to fill an internal void that cannot be satisfied. Recognising these signs is crucial in dealing with narcissists as it allows us to protect ourselves from their toxic behaviours. By maintaining awareness and establishing healthy boundaries, we can navigate relationships with narcissists and prioritise our own well-being. For more information about understanding and overcoming narcissistic and emotional abuse, click the links below. https://overcoming-narcissist-abuse.teachable.com/p/break-free-from-the-narcissist Check this out! 15 Rules To Deal With Narcissistic People.: How To Stay Sane And Break The Chain. https://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B0BYRLLGRJ/ref=tmm_hrd_swatch_0?ie=UTF8&qid=1679325458&sr=8-1:=:https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BYRLLGRJ/ref=tsm_1_fb_lk Narcissists Handbook: The ultimate guide to understanding and overcoming narcissistic and emotional abuse.-1 https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0C87NNBNP?ref_=cm_sw_r_mwn_dp_VKQZHN0VXE8W4WXTQQ20:=:https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0C87NNBNP/ref=cm_sw_r_mwn_dp_VKQZHN0VXE8W4WXTQQ20 (Sponsored.). https://betterhelp.com/elizabethshaw:=:https://www.betterhelp.com:443/

OPEN HEAVENS DAILY DEVOTIONAL DATE: SUNDAY OCTOBER 15TH 2023 TOPIC: THE LAND OF ENDLESS SUFFERINGS MEMORISE: 'And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth." - MATTHEW 13:42 READ: MATTHEW 13:24-30, 36-43 (KJV) 24 Another parable put He forth unto them, saying, The Kingdom of Heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field: 25 But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way. 26 But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also. 27 So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? From whence then hath it tares? 28 He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up? 29 But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them. 30 Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn. 36 Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and His disciples came unto Him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field. 37 He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of Man; 38 The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the Kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one; 39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the Angels. 40 As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. 41 The Son of Man shall send forth His Angels, and they shall gather out of His Kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity; 42 And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. 42 Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear. MESSAGE: Those who don't end up in the City of God will end up in another place that I cannot describe as a city. I can only describe it as a place of endless sufferings because it is a land of unimaginable horrors. All the residents of this horrific place are in constant suffering for eternity. That place is called hell fire (Mark 9:47). The first thing you need to know about hell fire is that it is a place of torment. Luke 16:23 describes the experience of a man in hell as follows: "And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom." All occupants of hell are tormented non-stop. In Mark 9:48, Jesus tells us some of the things that torment them: "Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched." The passage does not say 'the worm' does not die, but 'their worm'. In other words, worms will be coming out of the body of the people there, and these worms cannot be killed. They just keep eating their victims up. Also, there is an unquenchable fire there that keeps burning the occupants of hell non-stop. In Matthew 25:41, Jesus said the fire is everlasting. Revelations 14:11 says that the smoke of their torment in hell goes up forever and that there is no rest day or night; the torment just goes on without stopping for eternity. A drop of water will be a luxury to the people in hell (Luke 16:24). Can you imagine such torment? There is no nightmare that can compare to the actual experience of hell fire. There are many passages in the Bible where Jesus described hell as a place where there will be a lot of weeping, wailing and gnashing of teeth. Even assuming that the torments are the cause of their wailing, what then will make them gnash their teeth? Gnashing of teeth is something people do when they regret their actions or inactions. The people in hell will be gnashing their teeth for eternity, regretting that they did not live holy lives when they were on earth. You are still here on earth, so you have the opportunity that those people will give anything to have again. You have the opportunity to repent and start living holy now. If you delay until it is too late, you will remember this message in hell and wish you had listened. Choose wisely. REFLECTION: Think about it carefully: are you willing to go to hell becasuse of that sin that you keep committing? If not, stop it today. BIBLE IN ONE YEAR: MARK 6-7 AUTHOR: PASTOR E A. Good morning to all our followers and to a very delicate subject that I‚Äôve ignored for several days now but now feel I must address. The latest news and hype is the Palestinian attack on Israel that killed three hundred people which will obviously provoke more conflict between both countries. As with any conflict it‚Äôs politics and sides will be taken . One post in particular on this page goes back to the September commemorations at Ginkel Heath and has been receiving comments of an inflammatory nature . Now unfortunately I‚Äôve said this once twice and it probably won‚Äôt be the last time . The Arnhem Boys is not your private political platform to vent your spleen on. At the risk of becoming repetitive our aim is solely to our Arnhem Veterans and their families and to ensure our past is not forgotten and remains in our future. Reading some of the comments I‚Äôm also receiving personal messages to the effect that some political views aren‚Äôt the sort of thing that‚Äôs expected on a veterans page . Having said that I as admin am duty bound to intervene. We are purely a Veterans Page and as the page is growing so rapidly I obviously don‚Äôt want to lose anyone‚Äôs support . But again WE ARE NOT A POLITICAL PLATFORM FOR THE TROUBLES OF THE WORLD ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶especially when feelings run high for both countries involved. So regrettably I have to put my Policeman‚Äôs hat on again and say this, any posts in future that are NOT of an Operation Market Garden subject and refer to modern political controversy ie Israel/Palestine will most certainly be removed . Whilst I‚Äôm the biggest advocate for democracy‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶, there is a time and a place for everything and it‚Äôs not going to be on this page . My first duty as admin is to uphold the love and respect of the lads that took part in Operation Market Garden seventy nine years ago . If you have been involved in the 102nd birthday adoration of our Ron Johnson . You‚Äôll notice that the numbers are now in their high thousands and I‚Äôm left reeling at the comments. But knowing Ron he‚Äôs also an adorable character. I will not allow anything to distract from our devotion of our veterans . If you wish to become involved in modern day politics and conflict please seek out pages dedicated to it ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.NOT The Arnhem Boys because I will as soon as they land delete them . Thank you for your time & patience. Admin Trevor Williams .

Ladies , gentlemen and all our followers . The comments and sheer adoration for Veteran Ron Johnson‚Äôs 102nd birthday wishes has broken all records of such wishes for our veterans ‚Ä¶..as one of your admins for this page it‚Äôs left me reeling with the amount of kindness you‚Äôve all shared for Ron . They say that first impressions are lasting and from day one of meeting Ron Darren said to me the way his men looked up to him had to be seen . I‚Äôve found and included to this post a short piece of video film of Ron speaking at the internment of the late Des Page‚Äôs ashes near the Whitehouse where both Des and Ron fought side by side. You‚Äôll hear Ron speak about his former Sargent as Darren lays Des beside his former colleague the late Iain Bonner. These snippets of film are as important as the battles they fought in . Because they show the true and lasting camaraderie that is only ever found of fighting men. To my Darren who knew Des and Iain and very much knows our Ron . He said these moments in time he‚Äôll never forget and is so proud and fortunate to have been part of their lives as The Arnhem Boys. Next year sees the 80th Anniversary of Operation Market Garden. It is our hope to make an appearance next year to celebrate the lives of all who served , fought and died during the conflict . We‚Äôll honour as always those veterans that are still with us . We‚Äôll also honour those that payed the highest price for victory. But until then join with us and enjoy a little more from birthday boy Ron Johnson . God bless you Ron and daughter Valerie Sanders ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ Admin : Trevor Williams Darren Williams ( film)
