Justice Inyang Okoro to head Supreme Court panel on presidential election Petition. Justice John Inyang Okoro has been nominated to coordinate the Supreme Court panel that will oversee the presidential election petition filed by the candidates of Labour Party (LP), Mr. Peter Gregory Obi, and the People Democratic Party PDP), Alhaji Atiku Abubakar, respectively. News Band gathered that Justice Okoro is currently coordinating other Justices of the Supreme Court out of the total of eleven Justices currently serving in the apex court. An insider, however, revealed to this medium that there is heavy arm-twisting among the Justices as the majority are insisting on following the electoral act and the federal constitution governing elections in the country devoid of technicalities. In the meantime, it was learnt that the Chief Judge of the Federation, Chief Justice Olukayode Ariwoola and Justice Kekere-Ekun have both recused themselves to avoid conflict of interest. Justice Ariwoola, this medium was informed, recused himself over his longstanding relationship with President Bola Ahmed Tinubu who is one of the Respondents in the petitions. On her part, Justice Kekere-Ekun recused herself over her relationship with Alhaji Abubakar through her husband who is a serving board member of American University of Nigeria, Yola, owned by the PDP flag bearer. Justice Okoro, it was gathered, is faced with an uphill task of securing a unanimous judgement from the seven justices required by Law to be on the panel. Another source, who spoke on condition of anonymity, meanwhile revealed that the ‚Äúarm-twisting‚Äù involves the Department of State Security (DSS) and the Attorney General of the Federation (AGF), Yusuf Fagbemi. Fagbemi, the source said, is the middle man between the camp of the presidency and the Supreme Court led by Justice Inyang Okoro. It is left to be seen whether the Justices of the Supreme Court will uphold the electoral act and the constitution or whether they will rely on technicalities like the Presidential Election Petition Court (PEPC). According to information gleaned from the apex court website, currently, there are eleven Justices. With the recusal of both Chief Justices Ariwoola and Kekere-Ekun due to conflicts of interest, only nine remain from which seven will be selected. According to the source, the three Justices are under heavy pressure to either unflinchingly adhere to the constitution without compromise, which will be a blow to the camp of Tinubu, or play along as the judges of PEPC were accused of.

Serbisyo Caravan isinagawa sa Barangay Dagsa, Sogod, Southern Leyte Matagumpay na naisagawa ng Provincial Task Force at Municipal Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict sa Lalawigan ng Southern Leyte at Munisipyo ng Sogod, ang Serbisyo Caravan para sa mga residente ng barangay Dagsa, noong huwebes, ika- labindalawa ng Oktobre taong kasalukuyan. Ang lokal na pamahalaan ng Sogod, Southern Leyte, sa Pamumuno ni Hon. Sheffered Tan, Municipal Mayor kasama ang 14th Infantry "Avenger" Battalion, Philippine Army sa pangunguna ni LTC EDGAR A GABIA, Commanding Officer, 14IB, katuwang ang iba't ibang ahensya at mga pribadong organisasyon ay nagsagawa ng Serbisyo Caravan para sa mga residente ng Barangay Dagsa, Sogod, Southern Leyte. Ito ay partikular na ginawa para mabigyan ng serbisyo ang mga residente ng nasabing Barangay. Kabilang sa mga opisina at ahensyang naghahatid ng serbisyo at programa ng nasabing caravan ay ang DILG, DENR, DOH sa pamamagitan ng Municipal Health Services Office, DTI, DOLE, TESDA, DPWH, DAR, PCA, PCIC, PDAO, at iba pa. Libreng Medical Check-up, ear piercing, pang gugupit, pamamahagi ng mga buto o binhi at school supplies ay ilan lamang sa mga programa at serbisyong tinatamasa ng mga residente sa nabanggit na barangay. Maliban dito, nagkaroon din ng pagpupulong kung saan nabigyan ng pagkakataon ang mga residente na magtanong tungkol sa iba‚Äôt ibang ahensya ng gobyerno. Ipinaliwanag din ng 14IB ang tungkol sa siguridad ng mga residente laban sa masamang gawain ng komunistang teroristang grupo ng CPP-NPA-NDF. Ayon dito, nagpapasalamat ang mga opisyal at residente ng nabanggit na barangay sa tulong ng gobyerno. Nagpahayag din sila ng suporta sa programa ng gobyerno para wakasan ang pangmatagalang problema sa insurhensya na dulot ng komunistang teroristang grupo. #AFPyoucanTRUST #ServiceWithCompassion #EndLocalCommunistARMConflict 8th Forward Service Support Unit, ASCOM, PA - Eastern Visayas802nd Infantry (Peerless) Brigade, 8ID, Philippine ArmyBravo "Blackhawk" Company 14th Infantry BattalionAlpha "Achiever" Company 14th Infantry "Avenger" BattalionCharlie "Viper" Company, 14th Infantry "Avenger" Battalion8th Regional Community Defense Group, Reserve Command, Philippine Army8th Regional Community Defense Group, Reserve Command, Philippine Army8th Civil-Military Operations Battalion - Home of Dangpanan 100.1FMDILG Southern LeyteDILG Leyte Province

üîµ‚ö™Ô∏è…¢·¥è ü·¥Ö·¥á…¥ ·¥è·¥ò·¥ò·¥è Ä·¥õ·¥ú…¥…™·¥õ è …¢·¥è·¥áÍú±  ô·¥á…¢…¢…™…¥…¢ “ì·¥è Ä Íú±·¥õ Ä·¥Ä è “ì·¥èxxüîµ‚ö™Ô∏è Via SMH Sport üì∞ By Danny Weidler ‚úçÔ∏è In a horrible case of bad timing mixed with terrible behaviour, Josh Addo-Carr has embarrassed Bulldogs club bosses again and wasted the time of the boss of the game, Peter V‚Äôlandys. Addo-Carr was meant to have a high-level meeting with ARL Commission chairman V‚Äôlandys just days before he was involved in a brawl at the Koori Knockout on the Central Coast. A meeting was called by Bulldogs general manager Phil Gould to help Addo-Carr plan a career after football. Addo-Carr was a late withdrawal from the meeting because of his selection in the Australian Prime Minister‚Äôs XIII to play Papua New Guinea on September 30 ‚Äì which he also withdrew from. Addo-Carr‚Äôs agent, Mario Tartak, and the star winger‚Äôs partner represented him. Gould initiated the idea of Addo-Carr becoming the face of Indigenous rugby league in the closing years of his time at Bulldogs and then into retirement. That shows the level of regard that Gould has for Addo-Carr and flies in the face of suggestions that the pair have had ongoing issues. If Gould has now lost faith in Addo-Carr it would be understandable. Bulldogs officials and all of those who have gone out of their way to support him have been let down in recent times by his actions. Addo-Carr lost his cool at the Koori Knockout, and even his closest supporters say he has got what he deserved in terms of his two-match ban, $5000 fine and exclusion from the Kangaroos for the Pacific Championships. His teammates on the day and those who saw the event say there was no real excuse for his actions. Addo-Carr then posted on social media on Wednesday about the conflict between Israel and Palestine, and then had to apologise for that as well. It was embarrassing for the Bulldogs and another problem they didn‚Äôt need to deal with. Have you ever come across a historic gravesite on the Payette National Forest? Usually, these sites have an identifiable marker, such as a headstone, wooden sign, or fence. The Heritage Program maintains approximately 15 historic gravesites and cemeteries across the forest, to memorialize those individuals and honor the history across the landscape. ‚ÄúMaintaining gravesites is an act that goes beyond historic preservation, it also connects us with people in the past, as we often share experiences despite the distance of time,‚Äù said Morgan Zedalis, Forest Archaeologist. The Heritage Program, along with the help of volunteers or local youth programs, visits about three gravesites a year to do maintenance. Maintenance typically consists of trimming overgrown brush, repairing fences, and repainting signs. This fall, heritage staff repaired the fence at Deadman‚Äôs Bar, using native materials found near the site. Zedalis hopes to replace the fence next year, with materials and a design able to withstand the heavy snow load. Typically, historic gravesites are associated with homesteaders and miners and the Heritage Program utilizes archives and references to document the history of the people who are buried on the Forest. Sometimes that search produces a great deal of information, in other cases very little information, and sometimes information is conflicting and is not supported by much evidence. In such cases, archaeologists document all of the information as possibilities. ‚ÄúIn the case of Deadman‚Äôs Bar on the East Fork of the South Fork of the Salmon River, there is one account for the site that Chinese miners and Euro-American miners had a conflict whereby four people died at the site. Another account is that a Union Civil War veteran named James Reagan was buried there in 1877,‚Äù said Zedalis.

Twitter: Isaac Saul @Ike_Saul People ask me all the time if I am "pro-Israel" because I am a Jew who has lived in Israel, and my answer is that being "pro-Israel" or being "pro-Palestine" or being a "Zionist" does not properly capture the nuance of thought most people do or should have about this issue. It certainly doesn't capture mine. I have a lot to say. I‚Äôve spent the last 72 hours writing, texting, and talking to Israelis, Jews, Muslims, and Palestinians. Much of my reaction is going to piss off people on "both sides," but I am exhausted and hurting and I do not think there is any way to discuss this situation without being radically honest about my views. So I'm going to try to say what I believe to be true the best I can. Let me start with this: It could have been me. That's a hard thought to shake when watching the videos out of Israel ‚Äî the concert goers fleeing across an empty expanse, the hostages being paraded through the streets, the people shot in the head at bus stops or in their cars. I went to those parties in the desert, I rubbed shoulders with Israelis and Arabs and Jews and Muslims, I could have easily accepted an invitation to some concert near Sderot and gone without a care, only to be indiscriminately slaughtered. Or, perhaps worse, taken hostage and tortured. I don‚Äôt believe Hamas is killing Israelis to liberate themselves, nor do I believe they are doing it to make peace. They're doing this because they represent the devil on the shoulder of every oppressed Palestinian who has lost someone in this conflict. They're doing it because they want vengeance. They are evening the score, and acting on the worst of our human impulses, to respond to blood with blood ‚Äî an inclination that is easy to give in to after what their people have endured. It should not be hard to understand their logic ‚Äî it is only hard to accept that humans are capable of being driven to this. Not defending Hamas is a very low bar to clear. Please clear it. It‚Äôs not possible to recap the entire 5,000 year history of people fighting over this strip of land in one newsletter. There are plenty of easily accessible places you can learn about it if you want to (and, by the way, many of you should ‚Äî far too many people speak on this issue with an obscene amount of ignorance, loads of arrogance, and a narrow historical lens focused on the last few decades). But I'll briefly highlight a few things that are important to me. In my opinion, the Jewish people have a legitimate historical claim to the land of Israel. Jews had already been expelled and returned and expelled again a half dozen times before the rise of the Muslim and Arab rule of the Ottoman Empire. Of course it‚Äôs messy because we Jews and Arabs and Muslims are all cousins and descendents of the same Canaanites. But Arabs won the land centuries ago the same way Israel and Jews won it in the 20th century: Through conflict and war. The British defeated the Ottoman Empire and then came the Balfour Declaration, which amounted to the British granting the area to the Jewish people, a promise they‚Äôd later try to renege on ‚Äî all before the wars that have defined the region since 1948. That historical moment in the late 1940s was unique. After World War II, with many Arab and Muslim states already in existence, and after six million Jews were slaughtered, the global community felt it was important to grant the Jewish people a homeland. In a more logical or just world that homeland would have been in Europe as a kind of reparation for what the Nazis and others before them had done to the Jews, or perhaps in the Americas ‚Äî like Alaska ‚Äî or somewhere else. But the Jews wanted Israel, the British had taken to the Zionist movement, the British had conquered the Ottoman Empire which handed them control of the land, and America and Europe didn‚Äôt want the Jews. As a result, we got Israel. The Arab states had already rejected a partitioned Israel repeatedly before World War II and rejected it again after the Holocaust and the end of the war. They did not want to give up even a little bit of their land to a bunch of Jewish interlopers who were granted it all of a sudden by British interlopers who had arrived a hundred years prior. Who could blame them? It had been centuries since Jews lived there in large numbers, and now they wanted to return in waves as secularized Europeans. Many of us would probably react (truncated)

Australia is providing an initial $10 million in humanitarian assistance for civilians affected by the conflict in Gaza. Australia will provide $3 million to the International Committee of the Red Cross to fund urgent needs like restoring essential services and providing medical support to victims of the conflict. Through United Nations agencies, Australia will provide $7 million to deliver critical support including emergency water, nutrition, sanitation and hygiene services, as well as child protection. Australia will continue to monitor and assess the humanitarian situation and stands ready to provide further support. Quote attributable to Minister for Foreign Affairs, Senator the Hon Penny Wong: ‚ÄúWe have seen devastating loss of innocent life since the heinous attacks on Israel by brutal terrorist group Hamas. ‚ÄúFar from representing the Palestinian people, Hamas undermines Palestinian needs and aspirations. ‚ÄúWe continue to call for the unconditional release of all hostages. We stand with Israel and reiterate its right to defend itself. ‚ÄúPresident Biden has called on Israel to operate by the rules of war in its response to Hamas attacks - we join him and others in that call. ‚ÄúWe call for safe and unimpeded humanitarian access to civilians affected by the worsening humanitarian crisis in Gaza. ‚ÄúWe call for the establishment of a corridor to enable humanitarian needs to be met. And we support the work of the United States, Egypt and others towards this goal. ‚ÄúAdherence to international humanitarian law must be prioritised - including the protection of civilians, wherever they live.‚Äù Quote attributable to Minister for International Development and the Pacific, the Hon Pat Conroy MP: ‚ÄúAustralia‚Äôs contribution through our trusted partners supports the humanitarian crisis affecting civilians caught up in this conflict. ‚ÄúOur assistance will prioritise the immediate needs of civilians, ensuring support reaches those most in need. ‚ÄúWe call for the protection of, and unimpeded access for, humanitarian workers who are delivering lifesaving support.‚Äù

Matthew 13:42 READ: MATTHEW 13:24-30, 36-43 24 Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field: 25 But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way. 26 But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also. 27 So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares? 28 He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up? 29 But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them. 30 Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn. 36 Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field. 37 He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man; 38 The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one; 39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels. 40 As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. 41 The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity; 42 And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. 43 Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear. MESSAGE: Those who don't end up in the City of God will end up in another place that I cannot describe as a city. I can only describe it as a place of endless sufferings because it is a land of unimaginable horrors. All the residents of this horrific place are in constant suffering for eternity. That place is called hell fire (Mark 9:47). The first thing you need to know about hell fire is that it is a place of torment. Luke 16:23 describes the experience of a man in hell as follows: "And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom." All occupants of hell are tormented non-stop. In Mark 9:48, Jesus tells us some of the things that torment them: "Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched." They just keep eating their victims up. Also, there is an unquenchable fire there that keeps burning the occupants of hell non-stop. In Matthew 25:41, Jesus said the fire is everlasting. Revelations 14:11 says the smoke of their torment in hell goes up forever and that there is no rest day or night; the torment just goes on without stopping for eternity. A drop of water will be a luxury to the people in hell (Luke 16:24). Can you imagine such torment? There is no nightmare that can compare to the actual experience of hell fire. There are many passages in the Bible where Jesus described hell as a place where there will be a lot of weeping, wailing and gnashing of teeth. Even assuming that the torments are the cause of their wailing, what then would make them gnash their teeth? Gnashing of teeth is something people do when they regret their actions or inactions. The people in hell will be gnashing their teeth for eternity, regretting that they did not live holy lives when they were on earth. You are still here on earth, so you have the opportunity that those people will give anything to have again. You have the opportunity to repent and start living holy now. If you delay until it is too late, you would remember this message in hell and wish you had listened. Choose wisely. ***Saturday 14th October 1066*** 957 years ago, at 9am, the Norman invasion force led by Duke William 'The Bastard', launched an assault against the massed Anglo-Saxon ranks of King Harold Godwinson at 'Battle' near Hastings in Sussex. The Anglo-Saxons held a dominant position on the top of Senlac Hill. Throughout the struggle, the Normans tried to break that fearful line and the result lay in the balance until late in the day. The conflict ended at around 7pm, following the death of King Harold; it was a very bloody contest. After the battle, William began a lengthy campaign to bring England under his control. During the next 21 years, there were massive transfers of land and power in favour of the Normans and English people were completely disenfranchised. A huge building programme began and the landscape was changed enormously. A new culture and a revised language evolved. In short, the Battle of Hastings, brutally and dramatically, changed the course of England's history.

Michael Corleone was not as good of a leader as his father. Not really even close. That‚Äôs from where a lot of the tragedy of the story stems. Vito Corleone was a man born into the right era. As tragic as the experience was of seeing his entire family murdered, it ultimately shaped his psyche into exactly what it took to be the greatest head in the underworld. After fleeing to America and following a brief attempt to live an honest life, Vito eventually grew into the role he was always meant to assume, as the don of the most powerful crime family in America. Vito also worked his way up from the very bottom of the underworld, and, having been in the trenches, was held in high regard by his lieutenants and subordinates. And, critically, Vito knew how to use violence only as necessary. He never believed in wiping out everyone, not even just his enemies. Vito believed in keeping friends close and enemies closer. As such, his men and the men in other families feared Vito, but also respected him. Michael‚Äôs track was different. He never truly embraced the family business, a major divergence in character from his father. While Vito never apologized for the life he chose, Michael‚Äôs greatest wish was to take the Corleone Family legitimate, an indication that Michael didn‚Äôt ever truly respect his roots. So, he was more ruthless than his father, willing to destroy all of his enemies, even if that meant his own brother. It‚Äôs one of the points of conflict that Michael and Tom Hagen discuss in the boathouse when Michael asks Tom if he will go along with Michael in these things Michael planned to do. Vito had taught Sonny and Tom to be light-handed when it came to violence, yet here was Michael trying to annihilate anyone who said a word against him. One thing about The Godfather Saga that probably gets overlooked or simply missed is, Michael was killing a lot of people by the end of the second film. When mobsters get to a point where they are that ruthless, there‚Äôs a tendency for the other families to band together and get rid of the cutthroat. This never occurs in the films. We‚Äôre sort of led to believe that the other heads of the Five Families and the Commission are fine and dandy with all of Michael‚Äôs actions. Realistically, there would likely have been a coup within his own family, or Michael would have been taken out the same way Vito took out Giuseppe Mariposa in the early 1930s, when Mariposa was murdering anyone he thought was against him. Dorothee Pullinger {Pioneering car designer at the Paisley Arrol-Johnston car works.} Doroth√©e was born in France in January, 1894. Her father was the car designer Thomas Pullinger and Dorothee followed him to become a pioneering automobile engineer in a man‚Äôs world. As well as being credited with designing the first car ‚Äúfor women‚Äù, Dorothee was also one of the founding members of the Women's Engineering Society , and was a life-long member and active in the society's Council. In 1910, Pullinger began work in the Paisley-based Scottish automobile firm Arrol-Johnston (the building was previously the Underwood Mill ) where she worked as a draftsperson. Pullinger remained at Arrol-Johnston until the start of World War I when it changed from producing cars to aeroplanes. She was appointed female supervisor of the very large munitions facility operated in Barrow in Furness, where women were employed in the manufacture of high explosive shells. In 1916, her father created a new munitions facility at Arrol-Johnston near Kirkcudbright which included an engineering college for women and an apprenticeship program. In 1914 she was told she couldn't join the Institution of Automobile Engineers because "the word person means a man and not a woman". After the war, she returned to Scotland where the munitions facility was converted back to the manufacture of automobiles and renamed Galloway Motors Ltd , where she was a director and manager. The company produced a car, the Galloway, for Arrol-Johnston that was designed for women. Galloway was no ordinary company. It adopted the colours of the suffragettes, had two tennis courts on its roof for employees, and Doroth√©e hosted an engineering college there. Apprenticeships lasted three years for women rather than the usual five for men because, it was believed, women were faster learners. It was something that had never been done before, a completely new concept to have women actually producing a car and designing the car in a way that made it more useable for other women to drive by making the steering again lighter. The company employed a largely female work force under Pullinger's direction and produced automobiles until 1923 when production was transferred to Arrol-Johnston's Heathhall works, but within six years the cars were no longer produced. Only 4,000 of the vehicles were ever made, with a model in Glasgow's Riverside Museum thought to be the only one on public display in the United Kingdom. After the conflict of the First World War she was finally accepted to the automobile institution as its first female member and awarded an MBE for her war work. She was an enthusiastic race car driver and won the cup in the Scottish Six Day Car Trials in 1924. Doroth√©e left the car manufacturing business after a spell of working as a sales representative for Arrol-Johnston. According to her children, she eventually became fed up with of people telling her she was "taking a man's job". In a complete change of direction Dorothee set up the White Service Laundry company in Croydon. During World War Two, she served her country once again. She was the only woman appointed to the Industrial Panel of the Ministry of Production, addressing post-war industry problems. After the conflict, she settled in Guernsey and established another laundry business. She passed away in 1986, aged 92. For Doroth√©e's children, she was a just a woman who tried to do the job she loved but believe their mother had it tough in Edwardian Britain. "Life is a challenge and you go for it," said her 84-year-old son Lewis, from his home in Guernsey in 2016. Doroth√©e's daughter, Yvette Le Couvey, said her mother spent a long time convincing Thomas Pullinger to let her work in his field. "I'm very proud," said daughter Yvette, who is now 93. "She achieved things - how many other women achieved what she achieved? It is all a question about going forward." Eddie McRorie Adapted from BBC article

#OPINION No place for disrespect: All leaders in South Sudan deserve respect The people of Jonglei State were rightly upset last week to hear reports of disrespectful behavior directed at their Governor, H.E. Denay Jock Chagor, by first deputy speaker Rt. Honourable Nathaniel Oyet during a parliamentary session. According to witnesses and televised excerpts from the session, Rt. Honourable Oyet, and the TNLA spokesperson launched personal insults and baseless accusations against Governor Chagor. However, we must remember that Governor Chagor, like all signatories to the 2018 Revitalized Agreement on the Resolution of Conflict in South Sudan, made compromises and commitments to establish sustainable peace in our nation. The agreement was the culmination of lengthy negotiations to end the devastating civil war that had cost so many lives. While political disagreements will always exist in a democracy, the signatories to the peace deal all recognized that open dialogue and respect must replace violence if South Sudan is to have any hope of a just future. Verbal abuse has no place in democratic governance or reconciliation processes. While policy issues with a governor's leadership can certainly be raised through appropriate formal mechanisms, hurling insults from the parliamentary floor damages our fragile democratic institutions and poisons the environment for the resolution of issues. The people of South Sudan have suffered tremendously from violence. Our leaders must set a positive example of resolving differences peacefully and respecting one another. For the sake of continued peace and stability, all parties to the 2018 agreement deserve our respect as long as they uphold their commitments to the democratic process and peacebuilding. Personal attacks have no place in moving our nation forward. The people of Jonglei state condemn the language used by some of the parliamentarians against the governor on the floor of TNLA during the summoning session on Tuesday, October 3rd, 2023. If the first deputy speaker and some members of the TNLA have policy issues with the Governor's leadership, there are appropriate formal mechanisms for addressing them through respectful dialogue and peaceful means. This message was prepared by SSUM/SSOA Party members.

In these days all we can do is pray for peace and count our blessings. The world seems to be on a fast track to actual devastation and the chaos of opinions seem like a breeding ground for further animosity and conflict. Spending the day playing with my child and being reminded of how simple it could be, she says hello to everyone, doesn‚Äôt see race or religious identity, doesn‚Äôt judge or condemn basking in the glory of innocence. It‚Äôs hard to fathom that innocence is our birthright in a world as divided as ours, and of course it‚Äôs naive, but we have to find that sacred innocence in ourselves and each other and see how we are one. The world appears to be telling us that the soul of humanity is in critical condition and when the damage escalates it quickly will be out of control if it‚Äôs not already. John Lennon‚Äôs song with its simple message of Give Peace A Chance is really the only solution. To give peace a chance and move as one people to a new spiritual understanding. We are one. We are equal, and we must learn to view each other through that lens or perish. Give peace a chance.

Kojima explains the reason for choosing the name ‚ÄúSnake‚Äù in Metal Gear Solid. The entire Metal Gear Solid series is full of snake names, but have you ever wondered why Hideo Kojima, the main developer of the series, chose this name to symbolize the heroes of the series? Well, Kojima finally decided to explain the reason through his account. On Twitter, Kojima said that the reason for using the snake as a code name in Metal Gear Solid is because it is the appropriate nickname for a person who is good at hiding, hiding traces, and can pounce on the victim without causing any noise. He also added that he did not use any specific names such as the cobra snake, the anaconda snake, and others because he believed that the hero would be the player himself and the method of play that he would follow. Kojima also explained that he used the word ‚Äúsolid‚Äù to give the player a sense of solidity, which is the opposite of something soft and weak. He also said that a snake can bite and attack another snake, and from this standpoint he got the idea of the conflict between the characters ‚ÄúSOLID SNAKE‚Äù and ‚ÄúLIQUID SNAKE‚Äù. Then Kojima thought of introducing a third character, and after using the cases of solid and liquid materials, he found no way except to reveal Another character has the third state of matter, which is gas, but the name of the character ‚ÄúGas Snake‚Äù did not appeal to Kojima very much, so he decided to delve into physics more and come up with the name ‚ÄúSolidus,‚Äù which is a substance between a solid and a liquid. #admin #progames #shady

Have you ever come across a historic gravesite on the Payette National Forest? Usually, these sites have an identifiable marker, such as a headstone, wooden sign, or fence. The Heritage Program maintains approximately 15 historic gravesites and cemeteries across the forest, to memorialize those individuals and honor the history across the landscape. ‚ÄúMaintaining gravesites is an act that goes beyond historic preservation, it also connects us with people in the past, as we often share experiences despite the distance of time,‚Äù said Morgan Zedalis, Forest Archaeologist. 

The Heritage Program, along with the help of volunteers or local youth programs, visits about three gravesites a year to do maintenance. Maintenance typically consists of trimming overgrown brush, repairing fences, and repainting signs. 

This fall, heritage staff repaired the fence at Deadman‚Äôs Bar, using native materials found near the site. Zedalis hopes to replace the fence next year, with materials and a design able to withstand the heavy snow load. 

Typically, historic gravesites are associated with homesteaders and miners and the Heritage Program utilizes archives and references to document the history of the people who are buried on the Forest. Sometimes that search produces a great deal of information, in other cases very little information, and sometimes information is conflicting and is not supported by much evidence. In such cases, archaeologists document all of the information as possibilities. ‚ÄúIn the case of Deadman‚Äôs Bar on the East Fork of the South Fork of the Salmon River, there is one account for the site that Chinese miners and Euro-American miners had a conflict whereby four people died at the site.  Another account is that a Union Civil War veteran named James Reagan was buried there in 1877,‚Äù said Zedalis.

A word from Pastor Carlos A. Morales Dear Brothers and Sisters in Christ, I want to address the recent rallies that have taken place in various parts of the world in support of Hamas. It is essential that we, as Christians and followers of Christ's teachings, engage in discussions and promote understanding on this matter. However, it is equally important to clarify our stance, as it may have been misinterpreted. First and foremost, we must make it clear that our opposition is directed towards terrorism and not against any specific group of people, including the people of Palestine. Our faith teaches us to love our neighbors and seek peace. It is in this spirit that we must approach complex and sensitive issues like the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. It is undeniable that Hamas has been designated as a terrorist organization by many nations and international bodies due to its violent actions and extremist ideologies. We condemn acts of terrorism and violence wherever they occur, as they bring suffering and pain to innocent lives. However, it is crucial to remember that not everyone who identifies as Palestinian supports or is involved in the actions of Hamas. The Palestinian people, like any other, consist of a diverse range of individuals with different beliefs, aspirations, and experiences. Blanket judgments do not serve the cause of peace, understanding, or reconciliation. Let us strive to distinguish between the actions of extremist groups and the aspirations of ordinary people, recognizing their rights and humanity. We should pray for peace, justice, and reconciliation in the region, understanding that the path to lasting peace is complex. In conclusion, while we denounce terrorism and violence, let us also extend our love, compassion, and prayers to all those affected by conflict, including the people of Palestine and Israel. As Christians, our calling is to be peacemakers and agents of reconciliation, seeking God's wisdom and guidance in these challenging times. In Christ's love, Pastor Carlos Art by Bansky Matthew 22:36-40 ‚ÄúTeacher, which is the greatest commandment in the Law?‚Äù 37 Jesus replied: ‚Äú‚ÄòLove the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.‚Äô[a] 38 This is the first and greatest commandment. 39 And the second is like it: ‚ÄòLove your neighbor as yourself.‚Äô[b] 40 All the Law and the Prophets hang on these two commandments.‚Äù

Rogue Success Elk Cervus canadensis The last few weeks have had me booked up fairly solidly with fall portrait photography and subsequent editing, so it was a nice change of pace to awake well before dawn this morning and see how things were faring in the valley of the kings. The elk rut has wound down considerably and is mostly over, and as I arrived at my destination only scant bugling was to be heard, where it was seemingly constant only a few weeks ago. I made my way in the general direction of the calls, but the few that I had heard were far out in the middle of the valley and the elk were mostly still invisible in the pre-dawn light. From a distace I did catch sight of a small harem that I might be able to photograph once the sun arose a bit more, so I made my way out into the 20 degree morning with hopes of a large bull with his end-of-season prize. Upon my arrival I was a bit surprised to see this smaller bull rounding up a harem of about a dozen or so cows. I could still hear bugling coming from a larger harem in the middle of the valley doing a call and responce with another big bull I had spotted making his way into the forest in the dark, but this younger one kept himself conspicuously quiet. My guess is that he was successful in peeling off the cows from the larger harem in the dark of night and was carefully keeping them a safe distance from the very likely much larger herd bull to avoid conflict, and staying very quiet to ensure his own safety. He seemed a bit anxious, not unusual for rut behavior, but gave the impression that he was more nervous about raising the ire of the distant herd bull than he was about possibly mating. At one point he even took off at a decent trot, far away from the cows. I thought for a bit that his nerves had gotten the better of him and he decided to give up on his small prize, but about 10 minutes later he came prancing back with no larger bull in tow (yet keeping a close eye on the general direction of the larger harem) and returned to his pacing about the ladies. I enjoyed the company of this small gathering for the next half hour or so until the sun broke above the distant hills and it was time for me to continue my morning with breakfast and a grateful heart. https://jamesdewaltphotography.com:=:https://jamesdewaltphotography.com/ Canon 5DmkIII EF 100-400mm f/4.5-5.6L IS USM 1/125s f/5.6 ISO 500

·Äî·Äö·Ä∞·Ä∏·Äö·Ä±·Ä¨·ÄÄ·Ä∫·Äô·Äº·Ä≠·ÄØ·Ä∑ Please check against delivery Statement by Ambassador Kyaw Moe Tun, Permanent Representative of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar to the United Nations Agenda Item 71: Interactive Dialogue with Special Rapporteur on the Promotion and Protection of the Right to Freedom of Opinion and Expression at the Third Committee of the 78th session of the UNGA (New York, 12 October 2023) Mr. Chair, Myanmar thanks the Special Rapporteur for her report on this important issue. There can be no trade-off between right to be safe and right to speak. Access to diverse, verifiable sources of information is a fundamental human right. And it is more critical for people in conflict-affected areas. Just as the report (truncated)

text: ‚ÄúIdentification with the aggressor‚Äù (or defensive identification) is an unconscious defence mechanism whereby a victim of aggression and suffering (an alienated child) aligns with and behaves like someone (the alienating parent), who is more powerful, hostile, poses a threat, or cannot be overcome. In this way, an alienated child will learn to lie and manipulate as their ‚Äòwinning‚Äô and ‚Äòstronger‚Äô parent does. Alignment and identification with the bully/aggressor also helps to suppress deeper feelings of guilt, vulnerability and shame. It‚Äôs like Stockholm Syndrome when a hostage feels powerless and aligns with their captor. They start to feel gratitude towards the aggressor when they are kind and (conditionally) loving. Deep down, the child/hostage will be aware that their alienating parent isn‚Äôt particularly healthy-minded or loving. The child knows, from experience, this parent is unpredictable, selfish/narcissistic, volatile, they run hot/cold - their parenting involves reward/punishment. The children are parentified, their childhood sacrificed to the adult problems of the alienator, and their reaction to narcissistic wounding as a result of what is usually a high conflict separation or divorce. To love a parent like this the child often will ‚Äòsplit‚Äô in order to cope. To make the alienated parent the villain/baddie is to make their life easier in dealing with the painful experience of alienation, and no longer being allowed to spend time with a loving and loved parent. It‚Äôs to switch off, and totally align with the alienating aggressor. The child is actually afraid of the alienator, and they can partially conquer that fear by becoming more like them, and that pleases the alienator too, which means the child may be less abused. Also, when a child witnesses emotional, psychological (or physical) abuse of a parent, it‚Äôs intimidating, terrifying, confusing, upsetting, and as a survival tactic, they feel that it‚Äôs best for them to be with the terrorising parent, the one it seems unwise to fall out with. There will be consequences. They are afraid and feel they‚Äôve lost one parent and don‚Äôt want to lose the other. What they see their alienating parent is capable of could be turned on them. The child ‚Äòtrauma bonds‚Äô with the parent who poses the biggest threat. This is why the child feels negatively towards the things the alienator/aggressor is negative towards ‚Äì it‚Äôs safer and easier to do so. They forget that their aggressor is really the origin of their suffering. I hope this goes some way to explain the phenomenon of why an alienated child supports, defends, loves and aligns with an abusive, mentally unstable parent while rejecting their more balanced and loving one. #parentalalienation #parentalalienationawareness #parentalalienationisreal #highconflictcoparenting #narcissisticchildabuse #alienatedparent #alienatedchild #rejectedparent #coercivecontrol #enmeshment #parentification #adultification #divorcesupport #custodybatt #fathersrights #mothersrights #charliemccready

"In dealing with conflict, we should first contemplate that our adversary wants to be happy and be free from suffering, just as we do. 

Next, try to see things from their point of view. By looking at the situation from their perspective, we‚Äôll be able to see clearly who has the mistaken idea, and who is in error. We will be able to see our own faults clearly, too. If, through this contemplation, we find that we are the ones in error, then we can begin to address those faults in ourselves. Should we confirm that yes, the other person is the one who is confused and at fault, we‚Äôll still be able to see the situation with compassion. 

We‚Äôll recognize that they are trying for happiness, but they misunderstand how to attain it. They might be harming us, and others too, yet we can understand that their behavior is actually impeding the happiness that they‚Äôre trying to achieve." -Mingyur Rinpoche

"It‚Äôs been a dreadful week. Humanity must prevail." Statement by Martin Griffiths, United Nations Relief Chief, about the latest in Israel, the Occupied Palestinian Territory and the region: "Civilians in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory are suffering from a week of utter anguish and devastation. I fear that the worst is yet to come. In Israel, families are reeling from the horror of last Saturday‚Äôs attack. More than a thousand people have been killed and many more have been injured. Over 100 people are held captive. In Gaza, families have been bombed while inching their way south along congested, damaged roads, following an evacuation order that left hundreds of thousands of people scrambling for safety but with nowhere to go. Nearly 2,000 people have been killed and many more have been injured. There is no power, no water and no fuel. Food supplies are running dangerously low. Hospitals, overwhelmed with patients, are running out of medicine. Morgues are overflowing. Homes, schools, shelters, health centers and places of worship are under intense bombardment. Entire residential neighbourhoods have been razed to the ground. Aid workers have been killed. The humanitarian situation in Gaza, already critical, is fast becoming untenable. In the West Bank, violence is on the rise, with a surge in civilian deaths and injuries. Families are facing ever greater movement restrictions. And in Lebanon, the risk of the conflict spilling into the country is a major concern. The parties‚Äô actions and rhetoric over the past few days are extremely alarming and unacceptable. Even wars have rules, and these rules must be upheld, at all times, and by all sides. Civilians and civilian infrastructure, including humanitarian workers and assets, must be protected. Civilians must be allowed to leave for safer areas. And whether they move or stay, constant care must be taken to spare them. Essential supplies and services and unimpeded humanitarian access must be allowed. Anyone held captive must be treated humanely. All hostages must be released. All countries with influence must exert it to ensure respect for the rules of war and to avoid any further escalation and spillover. The past week has been a test for humanity, and humanity is failing."

text: OPEN HEAVENS DAILY DEVOTIONAL DATE: SUNDAY OCTOBER 15TH 2023 TOPIC: THE LAND OF ENDLESS SUFFERINGS MEMORISE: "And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth." - (Matthew 13:42) READ: MATTHEW 13:24-30, 36-43 (KJV) 24 Another parable put he forth unto them, saying, The kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seed in his field: 25 But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way. 26 But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also. 27 So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares? 28 He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up? 29 But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them. 30 Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn. 36 Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field. 37 He answered and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man; 38 The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one; 39 The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels. 40 As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. 41 The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity; 42 And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth. 42 Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear. MESSAGE: Those who don't end up in the City of God will end up in another place that I cannot describe as a city. I can only describe it as a place of endless sufferings because it is a land of unimaginable horrors. All the residents of this horrific place are in constant suffering for eternity. That place is called hell fire (Mark 9:47). The first thing you need to know about hell fire is that it is a place of torment. In other words, worms will be coming out of the body of the people there, and these worms cannot be killed. They just keep eating their victims up. Also, there is an unquenchable fire there that keeps burning the occupants of hell non-stop. In Matthew 25:41, Jesus said the fire is everlasting. Revelations 14:11 says the smoke of their torment in hell goes up forever and that there is no rest day or night; the torment just goes on without stopping for eternity. A drop of water will be a luxury to the people in hell (Luke 16:24). Can you imagine such torment? There is no nightmare that can compare to the actual experience of hell fire. There are many passages in the Bible where Jesus described hell as a place where there will be a lot of weeping, wailing and gnashing of teeth. Even assuming that the torments are the cause of their wailing, what then would make them gnash their teeth? Gnashing of teeth is something people do when they regret their actions or inactions. The people in hell will be gnashing their teeth for eternity, regretting that they did not live holy lives when they were on earth. You are still here on earth, so you have the opportunity that those people will give anything to have again. You have the opportunity to repent and start living holy now. If you delay until it is too late, you would remember this message in hell and wish you had listened. Choose wisely. In the spring of 1742, a Shawnee war party journeyed hundreds of miles to the Eastern Shore of the Chesapeake Bay to recruit allies for a war against the English colonists. The once-mighty but diminished Nanticokes, whose great-grandparents had greeted Captain John Smith with arrows, invited several other tribes‚Äîthe Choptank, Assateague, Pocomoke, and Askecksy Indians‚Äîto meet at a place called Wimbesocom. A daring plan was proposed: With the help of hundreds of fierce northern warriors, the Eastern Shore tribes would carry out a surprise raid against their English neighbors and slaughter everyone-men, women, and children. Meanwhile, French forces would land on the coast and help them drive the white man off the peninsula, splitting the English colonies. If they succeeded, they would remake the destiny of North America. If they failed, they might lose their lands forever. 1742 traces the history of the Nanticoke Indians and other Eastern Shore tribes from their first contact with English colonists through decades of bloody conflict and bitter concessions, revealing a simmering resistance which boiled over during what historian C. A. Weslager called "the most important single event in Indian history on the Delmarva Peninsula.‚Äù

October 14 | Saint of the Day ‚ûï POPE SAINT CALLISTUS I Also known as ‚Ä¢ Callixtus I ‚Ä¢ Calixtus I Profile Born a slave, owned by Carpophorus, a Christian in the household of Caesar. His master entrusted a large sum to Callistus to open a bank, which took in several deposits, made several loans to people who refused to pay them back, and went broke. Knowing he would be personally blamed and punished, Callistus fled, but was caught and returned to his owner. Several depositors begged for his life, believing he had not lost the money, but had stolen and hid it. They were wrong; he wasn't a thief, just a victim, but he was sentenced to work the tin mines. By a quirk of Roman law, the ownership of Callistus was transferred from Carpophorus to the state, and when he was later ransomed out of his sentence with a number of other Christians, he became a free man. Pope Zephyrinus put Callistus in charge of the Roman public burial grounds, today still called the Cemetery of Saint Callistus. Archdeacon. Sixteenth Pope. Most of what we know about him has come down to us from his critics, including an anti-Pope of the day. Callistus was on more than one occasion accused of heresy for such actions as permitting a return to Communion for sinners who had repented and done penance, or for proclaiming that differences in economic class were no barrier to marriage. This last put him in conflict with Roman civil law, but he stated that in matters concerning the Church and the sacraments, Church law trumped civil law. In both cases he taught what the Church has taught for centuries, including today, and though a whole host of schismatics wrote against him, his crime seems to have been to practice orthodox Christianity. Martyred in the persecutions of Alexander Severus. Papal Ascension c.218 Died ‚Ä¢ martyred c.223 ‚Ä¢ legend says he was killed by being thrown down a well with a millstone around his neck, but there is no solid evidence Patronage cemetery workers Representation pope with a millstone on him or nearby St. Pope Callistus I, Pray for us! Source | Laudate #TheBeautyOfMyCatholicFaith #Laudate

In the midst of the horrors of the last week, it‚Äôs important to remember that Hamas has never wanted peace with Israel. Instead, the express goal of Hamas since its inception was the destruction of Israel. As stated in its first charter, published in 1988, ‚ÄúIsrael will exist and will continue to exist until Islam will obliterate it, just as it obliterated others before it.‚Äù It was ‚Äì and is ‚Äì the mission of Hamas to obliterate Israel, not make peace with Israel. As noted in an October 10 article in The Atlantic, ‚ÄúA close read of Hamas‚Äôs founding documents clearly shows its intentions.‚Äù Accordingly, the headline was titled, ‚ÄúUnderstanding Hamas‚Äôs Genocidal Ideology.‚Äù Genocidal indeed. As even NPR acknowledges, ‚ÄúThe group has vowed to annihilate Israel and has been responsible for many suicide bombings and other deadly attacks on civilians and Israeli soldiers.‚Äù And, just as Isis was a religion-based murder cult, the same holds true for Hamas. Both groups do what they do in the name of Allah, slaughtering the innocent in the cruelest, most demonic ways while shouting, ‚ÄúAllah Akbar.‚Äù (Raping women can also be done in Allah‚Äôs name in their demented form of faith.) That‚Äôs why you don‚Äôt make peace with the likes of Isis or Hamas. You thwart them. Put another way, people who proclaim, ‚ÄúWe love death more than you love life‚Äù are not ready to sit down at the table and reason together. As Robert Spencer said with reference to Isis, ‚Äú‚ÄòWe love death more than you love life.' This is civilization's ultimate challenge. Will the lovers of death and destruction overwhelm and defeat those who love life and have created great civilizations that celebrate human creativity and achievement? Will all that is left of three thousand years of human civilization be reduced to rubble and a mindless religio-ideological lockstep? ‚ÄúThe Islamic State is not just a challenge to Judeo-Christian Western civilization. It is a challenge to civilization itself--to the very idea of civilization. ‚ÄúAnd that is why it is doomed to fail. Life will always conquer death in the end. The human spirit will always prevail against the forces that would subjugate and enslave it.‚Äù Bear in mind that Hamas, an acronym for Harakat al-Muqawama al-Islamiya (‚ÄúIslamic Resistance Movement‚Äù) was founded as a more religiously based front for resisting Israel. (As a point of clarification, the Arabic word hamas means ‚Äúzeal‚Äù and is very close to the Hebrew word hamas meaning ‚Äúviolence.‚Äù But they are two distinct words, with similar, not identical pronunciations.) As noted on the Brittanica.com website, ‚ÄúFounded in 1987, Hamas opposed the secular approach of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and rejected attempts to cede any part of Palestine.‚Äù And while Hamas engaged in various acts of civil welfare for the people of Gaza, helping the populace in practical ways, it is the military wing of the organization that has made its lasting, deadly mark. It is also the military side of Hamas that absorbs the countless tens of millions of dollars that pour into its coffers from international aid that was intended for humanitarian use. Instead, it is used to build bombs and terror tunnels and the like. So much for being ‚Äúfor the people.‚Äù As far as the religious ideology of Hamas, understand that for a committed Muslim, the world is divided into two segments, Dar al-Islam, the territory of Islam, and Dar al-Harb, the territory of war. The former refers to those countries and lands that have been subjected to Islam (remember that ‚ÄúIslam‚Äù means ‚Äúsubmission,‚Äù not ‚Äúpeace‚Äù). The latter refers to the rest of the world that has not yet come under the sway of Islam. And what happens to land that was once under Muslim control but that then breaks free, such as Spain after the Moorish Conquest? This becomes an open wound, a recurring taunt and insult. How much more, then, when the evil Jews now control Jerusalem, considered the third holiest site in Islam, not to mention the rest of former Palestine? Israel must be driven out! As stated in Article 12 of the original charter, ‚ÄúNothing in nationalism is more significant or deeper than in the case when an enemy should tread Moslem land.‚Äù And so, when you hear that catchy chant, ‚ÄúFrom the River to the Sea, Palestine must be free,‚Äù it‚Äôs important that you understand what it actually means: ‚ÄúNo more Jews in the Land! No more Israel!‚Äù Is that clear enough? That‚Äôs why the original Hamas charter quoted the famous, authoritative Islamic tradition (hadith) that stated, ‚ÄúThe Day of Judgment will not come about until Muslims fight Jews and kill them. Then, the Jews will hide behind rocks and trees, and the rocks and trees will cry out: ‚ÄòO Moslem, there is a Jew hiding behind me, come and kill him.‚Äô‚Äù As for the revised charter published in 2017, one that toned down some of the language, the goals remained the same. To quote some relevant lines: ‚ÄúPalestine is a land that was seized by a racist, (truncated)

***Saturday 14th October 1066*** 957 years ago, at 9am, the Norman invasion force led by Duke William 'The Bastard', launched an assault against the massed Anglo-Saxon ranks of King Harold Godwinson at 'Battle' near Hastings in Sussex. The Anglo-Saxons held a dominant position on the top of Senlac Hill. Throughout the struggle, the Normans tried to break that fearful line and the result lay in the balance until late in the day. The conflict ended at around 7pm, following the death of King Harold; it was a very bloody contest. After the battle, William began a lengthy campaign to bring England under his control. During the next 21 years, there were massive transfers of land and power in favour of the Normans and English people were completely disenfranchised. A huge building programme began and the landscape was changed enormously. A new culture and a revised language evolved. In short, the Battle of Hastings, brutally and dramatically, changed the course of England's history.

Gaza hospitals were overwhelmed with casualties Saturday as the conflict between Israel and Hamas entered a second week. Witnesses said Israel struck a building in Khan Younis in southern Gaza that housed about 50 people who had fled there after the IDF ordered more than 1 million people to evacuate the north. A hospital in Gaza City treated casualties from what Hamas called an Israeli attack on a convoy heading south along one of two routes Israel had declared ‚Äúsafe.‚Äù Hamas said 70 people were killed. Israel said it was too early to establish who was responsible. The Palestinian Health Ministry said Saturday that 15 medical facilities have been damaged in Gaza, and two hospitals have closed. Meanwhile, many Gazans holding foreign passports gathered at the Rafah crossing into Egypt after word spread that they would be allowed to leave. YOUR LOVE LANGUAGE: GIFTS When your love language is Gifts, you shine at expressing love through thoughtful and meaningful presents. Here's what it looks like when you're at your best and potential trouble spots during conflicts or stress: At Your Best: ü•∞You excel at selecting gifts that resonate with your loved ones' interests, needs, and emotions, making them feel deeply appreciated and loved. ü•∞Your gestures, whether big or small, consistently convey your affection and thoughtfulness, strengthening the emotional connection in your relationships. ü•∞You remember special occasions, surprise your loved ones with unexpected tokens of love, and create memorable moments with your gift-giving prowess. ü•∞Your ability to make others feel special and valued through your gifts fosters a sense of appreciation and gratitude in your relationships. Trouble Spots During Conflict or Stress: üò¨ Misinterpreting Gifts: In times of stress, you might expect others to express their love through gifts as well, leading to disappointment if their love language differs. üò¨ Overcompensation: When facing conflict or stress, you might overindulge in gift-giving as a way to avoid addressing underlying issues, leading to miscommunication. üò¨ Expecting Reciprocity: You may unintentionally anticipate that others will reciprocate your love in the same manner, which can cause disappointment if their love language is different. üò¨ Financial Strain: Stressful situations can lead to overspending on gifts, potentially causing financial strain and further exacerbating stress. üò¨ Neglecting Verbal Affirmations: It's essential to remember that verbal expressions of love are equally important during conflicts. Make an effort to communicate your feelings verbally and actively listen to your loved ones' concerns. In challenging times, strive to balance your love for gift-giving with open and honest communication. Address conflicts by actively listening to your loved ones' concerns and expressing your feelings verbally. By maintaining this equilibrium, you can navigate stress and conflicts while continuing to express love through meaningful gifts.

text: For Palestinians and Arabs, the war did not begin on the morning of October 7 with Hamas‚Äôs attacks on Israel. Rather, for them, the war has been ongoing since 1948, when militias expelled Palestinians from their homes and killed tens of thousands in what is called the Nakba, or catastrophe.

Hundreds march for Palestine in London Hundreds of people, on Saturday, gathered for a pro-Palestine demonstration in Central London. Daily Mail reports the demonstration occurred amidst police warnings that expressing support for Hamas could result in arrest. In a video shared by The Telegraph, the people are seen with Palestine flags and placards chanting, "From the river to the sea, Palestine will be free," amongst others. Over 1,000 officers were deployed by the Metropolitan Police for the march, as supporters gathered in solidarity with Palestine amidst the conflict between Israel and Hamas. ---- Follow us for more breaking news and video content

President Geingob issues a passionate plea for peace in Israel-Palestine conflict IN a heartfelt appeal, Namibian President Hage G. Geingob calls for an immediate end to the violence and destruction in the Gaza Strip, emphasizing the need to protect innocent lives and infrastructure. Statement reads as follows: President Hage G. Geingob appeals for peace between Israel and Palestine, calls for an end to the killing of innocent civilians and destruction of infrastructure in the occupied Gaza Strip President Hage G. Geingob is deeply concerned about the grave humanitarian situation in northern Gaza following deadly attacks by the Israeli Defense Force (IDF) on innocent civilians, including women, children and civilian infrastructure, namely schools and hospitals. President Geingob re-emphasizes the fact that at the beginning of the 20th century, Namibians were killed on a large scale in a targeted and systematic manner by the German occupying colonial forces in what has been described as the first genocide of the 20th century. Therefore, as a country that has witnessed barbarity perpetuated against civilians by German occupying forces and later by Apartheid South Africa, President Geingob appeals to the international community and specifically the Israel to end the large-scale violence and horrendous airstrikes against the people of Gaza. The decision and order by the government of Israel for the people of northern Gaza to leave their homes and livelihoods within 24 hours is inhumane, it amounts to a genocidal act and must be rescinded. President Geingob maintains that the systematic state-sanctioned violence by the IDF in Gaza is wholly disproportionate and totally undermines international humanitarian law by failing to protect one million civilians, health workers and other critical infrastructure that is indispensable for the survival of the civilian population. ‚ÄúThe people of Gaza have a right to water; they have a right to food and electricity; they have a right to fuel and other basic necessities‚Äù, President Geingob says. As an occupying power, Israel has an obligation to ensure that the people of Gaza have access to these services. Furthermore, the President believes that the state of siege and the military onslaught against innocent civilians amounts to a genocide and the international community cannot afford to be indifferent in the face of this human catastrophe that is unfolding. President Geingob once again reaffirms the call Namibia made to the 78th Session of the United Nations in September 2023 that the people of Palestine yearn to transition from the inhumane conditions of oppressive rule. While pleased with the decision of the General Assembly to submit to the International Court of Justice a request for an advisory opinion on the legal consequences arising from the ongoing violation by Israel of the right of the Palestinian people to self-determination, President Geingob appeals to the United Nations Security Council to act swiftly to ensure respect of United Nations resolutions with regard to the right of the people of Palestine to live in peace and to determine their own future. President Geingob calls on both sides, including Hamas to desist from any horrific acts of violence that target civilians, leading to an escalation of the conflict. Moreover, President Geingob also calls for the release of hostages in accordance with international law. President Geingob restates, ‚Äúone does not make peace with one‚Äôs friends, one makes peace with one‚Äôs enemies‚Äù. President Geingob also maintains that ‚Äúwhen diplomacy fails, people go to war‚Äù. In that vein, President Geingob calls for an immediate ceasefire and appeals to all parties to return to the negotiating table and to pursue the moral path of a two-state solution in which the people of Palestine and Israel can live and co-exist as neighbours in peace and harmony. President Geingob extends a message of condolences to all those who have lost their loved ones, and wishes the injured a speedy recovery, during the ongoing, but avoidable Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

Oct. 14, 2023 In consultation with partners on the ground, The Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA) made a very tough but prudent decision to evacuate YAGM personnel, including the 5 Young Adults in Global Mission from the Holy Land and the country coordinators. We are relieved to share that everyone is safe. The images coming out of the news are heartbreaking and we extend our prayers to the Palestinian and Israeli people who have lost loved ones and are living in fear and uncertainty. We are deeply troubled by the escalating conflict and the impact it has on civilians. The ELCA has longstanding relationships with many partners in the region, including the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Jordan and the Holy Land and Augusta Victoria Hospital, which is operated by the Lutheran World Federation. For the last 30 years, the ELCA has had a presence of mission personnel, including a Young Adults in Global Mission program in Jerusalem and the West Bank. We did not take lightly the decision to evacuate our staff, and at the same time will always put their safety first. We pray for peace and justice.

Saturday Morning. October 14, 2023 I was in Gaza during the second intifada. I was in Bethlehem with Hamas when the Palestinians chose to elect Hamas to represent them, instead of the more secular Fatah. During the George W Bush administration, the goal, or the idea, was to try to help Muslim governments become democracies by helping them to have democratic elections. We found out pretty fast that you can‚Äôt impose the American style of democracy on other peoples. I was in Hebron just after Palestinians murdered Jews as they walked to the Tomb of Abraham to worship on the Sabbath. I was in Bethlehem just before Christmas when the Israeli Defense Forces came in to Bethlehem and exploded the home of a suicide bomber next door to where I was staying. I was nearly kidnapped in Jericho. We were meeting with Christians in Jericho when we got word that intelligence reports say that Islamists were looking to kidnap Americans due to some Israeli incursion that had just happened. We were informed to get out of Jericho fast. I was there with a group of about 35 pro Palestinian activists from the World Council of Churches, the U.N., and from a Palestinian Christian organization based in Jerusalem. A car full of kidnappers came racing toward me and another woman, who was a leader of the World Council of Churches, from Ireland. I saw what was about to happen. She did too. By the grace of God, the Palestinian Christian priest, who lead the church we were meeting with that day, stepped in between us and our would be kidnappers. He explained to them that we were there to support the Palestinian cause. He probably saved our lives. We both got on our bus. The Irish World Council of Churches activist got off the bus in Israel proper, never to return to the Palestinian territories. She was scared to death. I, on the other hand, headed back to Bethlehem with the rest of my group. Bethlehem is totally controlled by Hamas. Hamas leaders were very nice and respectful to us. They saw us as being there in support of their cause. My group was there in support of the Palestinians. I was in Israel just after the siege of the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem by Israel. There had been a bloody massacre of religious Jews while they were gathered together in a hotel banquet room in Jerusalem to celebrate the Passover. Some of the Palestinians believed to be involved in the massacre, or the planning of the massacre, ran into the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem for protection and cover. Israel surrounded the church but could not extricate the militants without killing innocent Christians who were being held in the church by the militants. In the end the militants were allowed to leave the church and go to safe haven in one of the Arab countries. I can‚Äôt remember all the details. You cannot Google these stories and find the truth. All the information we can access on the internet that involves the conflict in Israel, as well as American politics, has been tainted by people in power from one point of view or another. You cannot trust what you read . My group was going to Bethlehem to stand with the Palestinians in protest of Israel‚Äôs siege of the Church of the Nativity. I did not feel inclined to protest Israel, or be involved in anyone‚Äôs protest, so I stayed behind, alone, and walked the streets of the Old City of Jerusalem. There I met a young Muslim man. I can‚Äôt remember his name right now, but we became fast friends. He took me all around the Old City introducing me to his friends and showing me hidden places, even hidden places on top of some of the most famous Christian churches in the Old City, like on top of the Church of the Resurrection. I asked my young Muslim friend what is his opinion of the epoch clash between Israel and Palestine. He said what he would do about it, is invite Ariel Sharon, then Prime Minister of Israel, over to dinner. They would sit down and work the problems between their two peoples out together, over a meal. That kind of Muslim does exist in Palestine. But so do the ISIS like murderers exist in Palestine. I feel very guilty that I have not done more, or anything, with my work for peace in the Holy Land. I was there often between 1998 and 2009. I was mostly there during the years my daughter was away at college and medical school. When my daughter had her first child my priorities changed. I stay here with my family now. I feel guilty because I had a calling to it and a talent for it. It is like my old friend James taught me years ago. Everything in life has it‚Äôs counter sacrifice. I could have stayed in The Holy Land. I had so many incredible experiences and opportunities, including job opportunities, that God‚Äôs hand must have been in it. But I chose Meadows of Dan because my family is here. I had to sacrifice one or the other. I did not have the inspiration or inclination back then, when I was in the Holy Land, to write stories, or make pictures, or stay in contact with the people I met, or (truncated)

Throughout the week I have been hearing from families in Saskatoon who are connected to Jewish and Palestinian friends and families in Israel and Gaza. The sense of grief and fear at what is unfolding is profound. It is simply awful to see this escalation of violence and displacement and to know how much it is impacting people here at home. Yesterday in the New York Times UN Secretary General Guterres wrote an Op-ed that really resonated for me. In it he says: ‚ÄúWe have approached a moment of calamitous escalation, and find ourselves at a critical crossroads. It is imperative that all parties ‚Äî and those with influence over them ‚Äî do everything possible to avoid fresh violence or spillover of the conflict to the West Bank and the wider region. We urgently need a way out of this disastrous dead end before more lives are lost.‚Äù He went on to say: ‚ÄúIt is clear that the ongoing upheaval in the Middle East is polarizing communities around the world, widening divides, and spreading and amplifying hate. If truth is the first casualty of war, reason is not far behind.‚Äù This moment is a profound test of our humanity. It is urgent that the international community work towards de-escalation of violence in the region, the protection of innocent lives, and as hard as it may seem, work to build a path towards peace and security for everyone in the region. #yxe

text: On Saturday, central London witnessed a significant gathering of protesters numbering in the thousands. Their unified demand was clear: they called for an immediate cessation of Israel's bombing campaign and the siege on the #Gaza Strip, all while expressing concerns about a potential ground invasion of this small #Palestinian territory. Unfazed by warnings against displaying the Palestinian flag, demonstrators assembled outside the BBC's New Broadcasting House to voice their condemnation of what they deemed "Israeli aggression." This demonstration unfolded amidst ongoing airstrikes in the Gaza Strip, which had persisted for an eighth consecutive day. Earlier that same day, BBC studios in London became the target of a protest, with the exterior of the building being splattered with red paint. This act was carried out in protest against the channel's coverage of the conflict. When Middle East Eye sought a response from the BBC, no comment had been received by the time of publication. This rally, organized by Friends of Al-Aqsa, the Muslim Association of Britain (MAB), and other affiliated groups, resonated with pro-Palestinian voices. Chants of "Israel is a terrorist state" and "free Palestine" echoed as the protesters made their way from Regent Street, one of London's major shopping avenues, toward Westminster. In preparation for the event, more than 1,000 police officers were deployed, and the Metropolitan Police issued warnings. They cautioned that individuals showing support for Hamas, a group designated as a terrorist organization in the UK, or deviating from the approved protest route could face potential arrest.

text: Almost one week after the unprecedented terror attacks on Israel, by the militant Islamist group Hamas, Israeli troops have been carrying out localised raids inside Gaza. The military says infantry and tank units entered the strip to track down rocket crews, destroy weapons and search for hostages. The raids are taking place ahead of an expected ground offensive. Israel has massed troops and tanks along the Gaza border. Thousands of people are now attempting to flee their homes in northern Gaza. The Israeli military had given over 1 million people there just 24 hours to evacuate south. The United Nations has called the order ‚Äòimpossible,‚Äô and the terror group Hamas is telling people to stay in their homes. But many Gazans have decided to risk the journey before a possible invasion. Israel has also exchanged rocket fire with Lebanon and Syria, opening up the possibility of a wider conflict. Could Israel handle a multi-front war? US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has wrapped up talks in Qatar. He‚Äôs been travelling around the region in an attempt to prevent the conflict widening. He began in Israel, to show support and discuss hostage negotiations. Blinken also met the Palestinian president in Jordan. He says it‚Äôs vital to contain the violence. ‚Äì Localized raids‚Äô in Gaza: A first step in Israel military‚Äôs ground offensive? US shuttle diplomacy, holds talks in Qatar

Good Evening üí´ From a Christian perspective, emotional intelligence can be seen as a valuable and important aspect of one's character and behavior. Here is how. üìå Love and Compassion: In Christianity, love is considered a foundational principle. Emotional intelligence aligns with this by emphasizing empathy and compassion. Understanding and responding to the emotions of others with love and kindness is consistent with Christian teachings. üìå Self-Awareness and Humility: Emotional intelligence involves self-awareness, recognizing one's own emotions, and understanding how they impact behavior. This aligns with Christian teachings on humility and self-awareness, acknowledging one's own shortcomings and relying on God for guidance. üìå Self-Control and Patience: Emotional intelligence includes the ability to manage and control one's emotions. In Christianity, self-control is often emphasized as a fruit of the Spirit. The ability to be patient and slow to anger, as encouraged in the Bible, is reflective of emotional intelligence. üìå Relationships and Forgiveness: Christianity places a significant emphasis on forgiveness and building positive relationships. Emotional intelligence contributes to effective communication, conflict resolution, and building healthy relationships by understanding and managing emotions in oneself and others. üìå Empathy and Understanding: Jesus, in his teachings and actions, often demonstrated empathy and understanding. Emotional intelligence encourages individuals to step into the shoes of others, to understand their feelings and perspectives, fostering a sense of unity and compassion. üìå Communication and Truthfulness: Emotional intelligence involves effective communication and the ability to express emotions truthfully. In Christianity, there is an emphasis on speaking the truth in love. Emotional intelligence helps individuals communicate in a way that is respectful and considerate of others' feelings. üìå Service and Sacrifice: Christianity often calls for a life of service to others and sacrificial love. Emotional intelligence supports this by enabling individuals to understand and respond to the needs and emotions of others, fostering a spirit of service and sacrifice. While emotional intelligence is not explicitly mentioned in the Bible, many of its principles align with Christian values. The development of emotional intelligence can contribute to personal growth, positive relationships, and living out the teachings of Christianity in practical ways.
